name: Sloan Geiss
text: This place is so wonderful! One of the best restaurants in Auburn! You come in, pick your bowl size, pick your soup “base”, then order whatever meats/ veggies/ noodles you want and create your own experience. Invite your friends!!!

resp.text: Thank you, I’m happy to hear that you had a great time in Lucky Pot. Hope to see you soon. Thank you. Have a great day!

name: Emily Stone
text: LUCKY POT WAS AMAZING! I shared a double hot pot with three friends and all of the veggies, tofu, and beef were all fantastic. Such a fun experience, great prices, and VERY good food.

resp.text: Thank you so much. Glad to hear that you and your friend had a great time in Lucky Pot. Hope to see you soon. :)

name: Rosie Jones
text: Went out on a whim because I was hungry for good Asian food— was not disappointed in the least, if anything I was blown out of the water with the food and service. Very clean and neat dining area. I’ve always wanted to try hotpots, and this was a unique and delicious dining experience that I want to continue to have. Everything is fresh and brought to the table and you cook it yourself— with the option of a customizable sauce bar for your foods. Best part about this place is= it’s a healthy food place, not greasy in the slightest, I had a double hotpot with lots of veggies, meat, and noodles— so freaking delicious. It’s fairly priced, and you definitely get what you pay for (if not more because the food is fresh). I also had the ice pudding dessert, delectable and must try for a unique sweet treat. 5 stars all the way, delicious, authentic Chinese cuisine, lots of options for entrees, great service—- will definitely be back in the future!

resp.text: Thank you, Rosie. I’m so happy to hear that. That’s our goal for making y’all have a great experience with us. We will definitely keeping it, and improve much more stuff for y’all. Have a great night. Hope to see you soon.

name: Alec Morales
text: The food is great, especially for large groups of people. It is also a great experience just getting everything a la carte and cooking it yourself. The staff is super friendly and relaxed. Great vibes all around. We sat making friends and talking for several hours before realizing how long we had stayed. This is the go to spot if you want to get to know someone.

resp.text: Thank you, Alec. We are happy to hear that you had a great time here with us. Come back to see us. Love to be one of your spots. Have a great night.

name: Travis Johnson
text: I loved it! This was my first ever hotpot and I'm hooked. I'm definitely coming back for more. The staff is kind and respectful. They're more than happy to explain things to you if you've never had this before. Our waiter actually asked if he needed him to explain things. Food is plentiful and has every option you could ever want. Definitely recommend you get an order of dumplings and szechuan bacon!

resp.text: Thank you Travis. I’m so happy for you to had a great time in Lucky Pot. Come back to see us. We are aiming for a great experience for all of you. Thank you. Have a great day.

name: Justin Fetner
text: Lucky Pot is an amazing experience! It is an excellent choice for a group night out. If you have not tried the hot pot, they will explain everything in great detail. The staff and owner are super nice, and the service was impeccable! Go out and try it!

resp.text: That’s what we aiming for. Thank you. See you soon.

It always takes at least 45 minutes  to get your food and like I said it’s never been crowded with us there. The food is ok. Just ok. Go to Inori instead. All their food is great!!

name: J T
text: This has quickly become one of our new favorite spots. Food and portions are excellent and they offer a couple dishes, like sesame tofu, that we can't find in many other Chinese restaurants. Service suffers when they get busy, there never seems to be more than one server. That said, this is a great choice for before or after a movie or for takeout.

name: Joey Snowden
text: I typically make it a goal to find the best Chinese food in about every location I live in or am in for an extended stay. I'm happy to say that China Bistro has taken the prize for Hoover. The restaurant setting is modest, but comfortable. This is a place you can bring your family and not feel overwhelmed, or bring someone if you would like to spend the meal catching up or carrying on. I have tried enough on the menu to indicate they maintain a high standard for taste and when they say it's spicy, they are not misleading you into a bland meal with a hint of pepper. I would recommend this place to anyone I know.

name: Elysia Crecelius
text: China Bistro is fantastic! The service is wonderful and I have yet to order something that isn't cooked well and delicious. This is also a very kid friendly place. The owner makes great recommendations and is so nice to our two toddlers.

name: Jager and V
text: My husband and I had dinner here tonight and it was fantastic! The service was lovely and our food came out so quickly. The server recommended the Chili Oil Dumplings and they were superb. We will definitely be making this our go to chinese cuisine place! :)

name: Nick Kopp
text:
This is a real restaurant and you will not find Coke cans in the front and everybody getting their order TOGO.

Today I Tried the Spicy Crispy Cucumber cold appetizer today. It was incredible. Very spicy and refreshing way to get the meal started. After that I folded to my American ways and got the Mongolian Beef. It was very good as well. I can usually tell right off if a Chinese Restaurant is good or not from their Mongolian Beef (bad places it will taste stale).

Everything is very reasonably priced and service was friendly. Next time I will be a little more adventurous and try one of their authentic Sichuan dishes.

name: Angela
text: We have loved everything we have tried. The people are super friendly. We love eating there and getting it to go.

name: Ashlyn Carver
text: Everything was amazing. Especially the curry chicken! The service, atmosphere, waitress, and food was just glorious. Definitely will go back!

name: Jason Bell
text: Excellent food!! Use to go to Stix all the time until we discovered this little place right next door in the Patton Creek shopping center. Haven't been back to Stix ever since! Very nice people as well. Highly recommended!

text: The food was outstanding! I just stumbled upon this place and was so glad that I took my friends to try it out! Everything was so delicious and the service was incredible. They gave us each a mango tea on the house! Great experience over all!

name: Kenny L
text: When I navigated to restaurant to order food, I suddenly saw these comments, which was really interesting. Today is my third time to order a meal in a restaurant. The soup dumpling tastes really delicious. I have only eaten in NY before.  I like dumplings very much, I like their seared pork shrimp very much, it is not as bad as those one-star reviews say.

name: Kim Chaves
text:
This place is ah-maz-zing!

Be sure to check it out later in the day since they make all their stuff fresh. Somethings won’t be available early in the day as they just open. The dumpling soup is my favorite (pictured in the steamer) the soup is inside the dumplings and is out of this world.

The dumplings and bao are nothing short of perfection. And you can get bao, dumplings, and the soup all for $25 and under! Do yourself a favor, go get some!

name: Myrissa Webb
text: This place was so delicious! We tried their Bao, soup dumplings, rice bowl, and mango drink! The people are so nice and hospitable! Definitely will be going back soon!

name: Dong Sun
text: My classmates and I went to eat "soup dumplings" together. It was great, especially the waiters were very friendly. I just saw a service that was rated very poorly?  Really malicious evaluation

name: Y S
text: Decent food and size for the price.  Good Service.

name: Nicole Stambaugh
text: AMAZING food and great service! Authentic food and the only place to get xiao long bao (soup dumplings) in Auburn! They are as yummy as the ones you can get at big chains like Din Tai Fung / in bigger cities. I am coming back every week! Prices are great for the quality and quantity of the food.

name: Jasmine Q Smith
text: Loved this place! My boyfriend and I love finding little hole in the wall restaurants and I just so happened to be find this place today via googling “dumplings in Auburn”😅. Kyle was helping us and was very kind and told us how the food was homemade and they haven’t been open to long. The soup dumplings were our favorite but their Pork Bao’s are a very close second. If your even considering going here just do it! You won’t be disappointed.

name: David Donica
text: Great first experience! My wife and I just moved to town and this placed just popped up. We took a shot and will definitely be a repeat visitor.💯

name: Federico Niekrasas
text: The food was delicious and is well worth the money. I got dumplings, bao (huge and delicious), rice bowl, and the amazing Bubble Tea! Would definitely recommend. The service was A++

name: Kaylee Robertson
text: Just picked up a to go order for the first time, and they let us have 2 free drinks because it was our first time! Wonderful customer service, and the bao and chicken rice bowl we had were AMAZING. Will be going back, highly recommend!!

name: Hagen Wasden
text: This was a great experience. First, the food is just amazing. We had the soup dumplings and pork bao. Second, the owner was very kind and actually gave us beef bao to try for free since this was our first time. The two one star reviews were definitely malicious because this place is great. Everybody who came in after us were treated just as well. Highly recommend!

name: Brianna Jackson
text: I don't know what some of these 1-star reviews are talking about, but the food was very good! Plus the service was very efficient. I got the pork belly rice bowl and soup dumplings, both of which tasted very authentic. If you're looking for americanized Asian food, or fusion, don't eat here. I can only assume that was the reason some reviewers gave 1-star.

name: Harrison
text: I've been seeing some mixed reviews but I got the number 1 lunch combo and it was so good. Basically Two meals in one. The sauce was so good also, definitely recommend to give a try

text: Ordering is simple, service is great, and the food will not disappoint. Definitely worth the price. A hidden gem

name: Clay Hodges
text: A brand new restaurant with awesome food, and so much cheer. This is our second time ordering 99 Bao and we haven't been disappointed either times. Try their dumplings, and get yourself and a friend an order of baos to share :) Also, this was the second time they threw in something a little extra with a note to thank us for ordering. So sweet, very appreciated

name: Cassidy Brydon
text: Absolutely delicious! Had the pork rice bowl, mango tea, and soup dumplings. Love it all. Definitely going back!

name: Jessie (Hyejun Jie)
text: Ordered Beef Shank Noodle Soup and Steam Bao on the first visit. Price was decent and food tasted great. Didn’t disappoint.

name: Nick Mastando
text: The lunch combo is one of the best deals in Auburn, all the food is delicious and the staff is super nice. Will definitely be coming back!

name: Kass Fowler
text: Love this place. I found it when they’d only been open for one week. Their xiao long bao (soup dumplings) are phenomenal. And you absolutely must try the Big Juicy Pork Bao—they’re fantastic. And the steamed and seared potsticker dumplings are top-notch. (I haven’t tried the entire menu yet.) All for great prices too! And the staff are awesome!

name: Blake B
text: The bao is awesome, especially the pork. The owners are very sweet.

name: Chris Adams
text: Had both pork and beef bao, steamed and fried dumplings, beef rice, and seafood bowl - all excellent. Made fresh, will be back!

name: Luke Haverkamp
text: Great dumplings! The lunch specials are awesome bang for your buck.

name: Julia Gorday
text: We ordered from 99 bao and they put sticky notes on all the dishes to let us know what each dish was and how to eat it! They also gave us free boba teas as a thank you! We all loved it the food was amazing!

name: Hongwei Chu
text: The service is fast and very good! Especially the noodle soup and Beef Bao taste delicious!

name: D'Angelo Baker
text: I am obsessed with their food. I honestly order from here too much. Highly recommend!

name: Lanqi Lanqi
text: The dumplings and beef noodles are really delicious, and the rice bowl with specially prepared sauce is also great

name: Jacob Benoit
text: Staff was extremely friendly and welcoming, and the food was delicious! Great spot!

name: wang zi
text: This is an authentic Chinese restaurant, specialized in Chinese food. They cook rice and soup in a real Chinese style. I order my breakfast and lunch here five times every week. But if you are looking sesame chicken or general tso chicken, look somewhere else. If you are looking sesame chicken or general tso chicken, go somewhere else. This is important. I think there are some American dude, they are sesame chicken kind of people, but come to this restaurant, asking the chef cook traditional Chinese noodle soup in a sesame chicken style. Sorry, it is cannot be done. This is a A+ restaurant for real Chinese dish. Specially, like Chinese breakfast bun, we call it “Bao Zi". Remember Auburn, before you go into a business, you should know what kind thing they offer and what kind thing you like. In a small town like Auburn, we all are lucky have this restaurant here. Their price is good, food good and close to campus. Thank you, your hard work means a lot to Auburn.

name: Davon Fox
text: Everything was undercooked...why do people like this?? I ordered it to go but that shouldn't mean the quality should suffer. Not much flavor either.

name: tate lauerdale
text: very good service and great food! very authentic - I have had soup dumplings many of times before and these did not disappoint!

name: Andrew Bingham
text: Great authentic food! Soup dumplings are good

name: Benjamin Webster
text: Food was fantastic and the staff were incredibly nice and helpful.

name: Hu Yuefeng
text: soup dumplings and the beef noodle soup are great. will be back .

name: Delilah Drost
text: I decided to try this since Irritable Bao downtown was so busy but trust me... THIS IS NOT WORTH IT. take the hour long wait downtown for real bao that doesn’t set off your gag reflexes.

name: Derek L
text: Super good food + really nice people!

name: Ye Lin
text: I don’t know why some people give one star , maybe the competition? Food is good

name: Sophie C
text: Sooo good. Soup dumplings are amazing.

name: SweetSuicune
text: Amazing food. Friendly place :)

name: Shelly Harrison
text: Nasty food. Tried bao and dumplings, both were gross. A couple hours later I was vomiting uncontrollably so I think this place gave me food poisoning. Won’t be going back.

name: Brian
text: Awesome

name: Miguel xum
text:
(Translated by Google) Very good

(Original)
Muy bien

name: Faye Day
text:
On Friday, Aug 21, 2020, I wanted Chinese Food. Therefore, I did some research on WAITR for the best deal and what I had a Taste. I ended up ordering from Wok Express.  I had the Luncheon Specials, that comes with an egg roll and fried rice. I also ordered a egg roll and the  6 angel crab.

I ordered the Shrimp Lo Mein and the Shrimp Fried Rice Meal and they were sooooooooooo Good. I don’t know about anyone else giving them a 1 rating. But, mine food experience was real good and I give them an overall 4.2 rating.   Let me tell you how!

First, my fried rice was actually FRIED RICE!  It had eggs, carrots and green peas in it; plus the onions I requested to add along with it for no extra charge. I couldn’t believe it! 😱😱 Why you asked? Because a lot of Chinese Restaurants don’t do that anymore. They give you fried rice and nothing else, and it’s sticky and gummy. But not Wok Express it was fresh and I had it for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. I didn’t want one grain to be lost Okay! ( Now my noodles was a little overcook but still good)

There was 12 large pawn shrimp in both my Shrimp Lo Mien and Shrimp Fried Rice. (See Pictures) Plus, I request onions to be added to Both items and make  it SPICY and they DID JUST THAT! 👏👏

However, other Chinese Restaurants that I’ve ordered from tell me that can’t do it.They cancel my order or ask me to accept it which is plain  fried rice nothing in it. Also, with no onions and not spicy. (Take a look at the pictures). Look how large my egg rolls are. Yummy!  Yummy! In my Tummy on All of it.  My Angel Crab was crispy, fresh and good. 😱😱  (SEE PICTURES)

I give my entire order a 4.2. I will say this;  I didn’t like that they sent me 2 nice large thick plastic forks that were not packaged. But they are among many other restaurants who send me silverware loose and I throw it away and use mines. I don’t know about you but with everything that’s going on, I don’t trust not having  my silverware in a sealed up package. But they did put my napkins in a bag to make sure they didn’t get wet. (I Requested they did) 👏👏

However, go make sure to get your Chinese there during Lunch time and save money. Next, if you order in make sure to check for a Free Delivery Promo Code to get your Free Delivery for WAITR.

New post; On Monday the 28, of December 2020, I order the Lunch General TSO’s and it was good, I also, ordered my favorite Spicy Shrimp fried rice on the Lunch Menu and asked for the side fried rice to be spicy and placed in a separate container.

Because, I didn’t want it mixed with my Shrimp fried rice but they didn’t do it. Also, I only receive 9 shrimp in my meal and it’s supposed to be 15 or 20 shrimps in my Shrimp Fried Rice. I’m very disappointed especially after the good reviews that I’ve given them.  I will always be fair and impartial but I’m very disappointed in how their quality of food portions have went down on my favorite Spicy Shrimp fried rice.

name: Ariaunna Webb
text: I'm new to the area and have been looking for authentic Chinese food. I ordered egg rolls and sesame seed chicken with fried rice for lunch. The food was flavorless and very dry. The chicken's coating is easy to peel off. It was no where near warm. I waited for more than an hour for this to be delivered and the place is 13 minutes away. I'm severely unimpressed and disappointed. I won't order here again.

name: Adam Powell
text: Decent, cheap neighborhood chinese. Food is consistent and always ready quickly.

name: Caleb Wilson
text:
I got hunan chicken and chicken fried rice. Order came out on time. Not the best ever but tastes good and served hot. Giant quantities so definitely enough for lunch the next day.

Hunan chicken was very spicy 👍🏼

name: CGRAF14
text: We try to support local restaurants, but probably won’t be going back to this one. Food was bland at best, the sauces were watered down. It was a bit over priced for takeout Chinese.

name: K.R H
text: The lady on the phone was nice, but that’s about the only good thing I can say. The tofu was the worst tofu I have ever had. Ever. I would not suggest this place to anyone wanting tofu. Seriously. Maybe their other food is nice, but the tofu is most certainly not. You’ve been warned.

name: Linda Le
text: This is my favorite Chinese place in the area, the owners are very friendly and the food comes out quick.

name: Shannon Hayes
text: Fast and delicious 🥡

name: Cheryl Henry- Boyd
text: Ordered the Seafood Special dish, with shrimp, scallops and crab. Scallops were slices and there was no crabz only that crab substitute that is fish. Would mot reorder from here.

name: micki082
text: Ordered food for a couple of days thru Waitr, over the weekend.  All gone, all delicious.  Hoping you'll stay on the delivery list.

name: Z D
text: Subpar food. Been twice now and each time was disappointed. Overall food was either completely bland or just one note spicy. They could have some good specialty but after trying both beef and chicken, we will be going elsewhere.

name: Best of Us Investors
text: Had carry out today sweet and sour shrimp came with no sauce, egg rolls came with no sauce. Over all very disappointing won't be patronizing in the future.

name: ed shaw
text: Ok, i order kung pao chicken and it was very disappointing.

name: Justin Lee
text: A great delivery place. Food is tasty and big portions. They have no problem with special orders (adding or removing an ingredient here and there) and the soup portions are huge. Little too much tofu in the soup but pour than that great.

name: John Norris
text: Storefront Chinese food is kind of a commodity. With that said, this place has great egg rolls and really good hot & sour soup. If you are old enough to remember the egg rolls at Joy Young's, you will feel like you have been swept back in time when you bite into the ones at Wok Express.

name: Donald Naccari
text:
Was excited to order the Sesame Chicken. It is a sorry dish.Tastes like battered chicken tossed in ketchup water. Sad.

The people were very pleasant.

name: John Tipper
text: Delicious food. Nice staff. Cheap eats. Friendly atmosphere. Long menu.

name: John Overstreet
text: Great hole in the wall Chinese place. Love to eat here

name: Victory Cobb
text: Great food, iffy staff. Will continue to come here but not my favorite. Also the soda's are only 12oz. Cans and limited.

name: Grey White
text: Wok express is the best. People very friendly and helpful. Clean. And food is fabulously yummy !!

name: Mew Thicus
text: Amazing food! Even more amazing that they deliver! Beyond impressed. Try the crab angels for sure.

name: K Toon
text: Mongolian beef is delicious and the portion size is almost too much for one person! But if you like spicy you have to ask for it. :)

name: samuel coburn
text: Pleasant people, slow on to go orders if you are in a hurry. Food is average but  better than most China take out.

name: Lauren Swillie
text: I ordered what I thought was chicken and rice... it looked like skinny long uncooked slimy white worms or something similar!?! Meat was also skinny and strange looking so much so I couldn’t eat what I got and threw $14 worth of food in the garbage.

name: Aubrey Yeager
text: I've gotten delivery from here 4-5 times now and it's always been just okay for the price. The last time I ordered (and it will be the last time), I waited an hour for the food. I can literally see the restaurant from where I live; it's that close. When I called to ask where the food was, I was told the driver was "stuck in traffic"... I called twice more and got similar responses/lies. When the food finally arrived, it was soggy and lukewarm. I'd also payed extra to have fried rice which I didn't get. Won't be eating here ever again.

name: Grant Briggs
text: Nice people, but food was mediocre at best. The egg drop soup had no flavor at all and the wonton noodles were stale.

name: Justin Hodges
text: Fast and friendly.  Hot and sour soup very tasty!

name: Sam Stockstill
text: Food was excellent! Ask for extra spicy if you like it hot!

name: kimzey Simpson
text: Great food, prices and great service

name: Allen Li
text: This place is really fast at cooking while still tasting good and have nice workers

name: Dallas Gregg
text: Awesome food. Nice people

name: Brandon Speake
text: You may want to consider having someone that can speak clear English handle any incoming phone orders.

name: Pete Horton
text: Great for lunches or dinners, regular lunch stop for me.

name: Unicorns Jewels (UnicornsJewels)
text: The food was good but the delivery needs major work placed our order at 5:20 max and our food didn't get to us until after 6:50 and the delivery person didn't say sorry or by your leave Nothing...And We gave a good tip before the delivery ever started.

text: Not very good food tasted old.

name: Taylor Robinson
text: Good food. Fast.

text: Faster than Jimmy johns

text: Their Chow Mein tasted like soap and the meat in their Mongolian beef was very bland also they messed up the amount of egg rolls we were supposed to get.

text: Pretty good, and delivers

text: Awesome food!

text:
(Translated by Google) very good

(Original)
非常好

name: Charles McCraw
text: I ordered a quart of sweet and sour pork and fried wings plus a diet two liter coke. The sweet and sour pork seemed rather small for a quart size coming in a small flat Tupperware. There was no sweet and sour sauce however the pork nuggets looked as if they had been microwaved in sweet and sour sauce. The nuggests where hard. The white rice was decent. The wings were actually good. Delivery was fast.

name: Ekaterina Bing
text:
Went there for the first time with my son. Let me start out by saying that the service is wonderful!  Ordered crab Rangoon as an appetizer. They were delicious- however, I would suggest more crab in the Crab Rangoon. They were mainly cream cheese Rangoon. We both ordered the lunch specials. He got teriyaki chicken on a stick with brown rice and I got sesame chicken with yellow rice and an egg roll. He didn't like the chicken on the stick. I did not care for the egg roll or the yellow rice. What happened to good old fashioned vegetable fried rice??
My sesame chicken had like 10 sesame  seeds on the whole order... Seriously, what is that? It's  a tease.
The best part were the cakes. I got the Alabama Coffee Cake and He got the Strawberry Cake. Both delicious!!

name: Brandon
text: I usually don't go during lunch rush. The place is very clean even built unique. They don't have buffets anymore however they do give a great potion for your order.

name: Sheng Zhao
text: Place looks good and the younger hostess is very nice, but the food is not even close to authentic. Garlic chicken somehow has no garlic and not even the taste of garlic. Also my order went to a different table and they didn't offer to make another one.  No fork or chopstick were given to me until i asked them. Heard buffet is more popular, so try to avoid non buffet.

name: david madison
text: Been here for 50 minutes waiting on my food to go.  You cannot understand the little old lady when she speaks. I understand that they're busy with all 3 customers in here including myself but hey! We got a free egg roll after my hour wait on my off day so it's totally worth it! Will not be back

name: Jason Pryor
text: Who's ever heard of a Chinese place that doesn't have fried rice??? They were good a few years ago, but they have become horrible. I ordered sweet and sour pork with brown fried rice. The pork was hard and rubbery, like it was microwaved. The rice was just plain brown rice. It was basically like instant brown rice. I called to ask them about the rice. I told them there was nothing in the rice. They said they don't do fried rice with anything in it anymore. Seriously!?!? Not to mention, the delivery guy looked like a homeless person. He smelled really bad too, and this is the person bringing me my food?

name: Jessica Bella
text: My food was absolutely terrible. I ordered the beef and broccoli and had to send it back because it had no flavor or sauce on it. So they replaced it with General Taos chicken. It is supposed to be spicy and one section of on piece of chicken was extremely spicy and the rest has no spicy whatsoever. It was sweet like it had sugar on it  same with the rice. So I called again and had some woman screaming in the background saying she will come to my house to. "Tell me what's up". I found out this is the manager. They would not give a refund and tried to replace the order again but it is almost 11pm. I am extremely displeased by this business and their behavior and food

name: katie underwood
text: My roommate and I wanted to try this place because all the reviews were so good, now I see why! We arrived at 2 and they made everything fresh for us, very nice service and they made whatever that we wanted.  Very happy, we will deff be back!

name: Jaylon Jackson
text: My experience was terrible. My food was disgusting. I ordered a sweet and sour combo, and once I got my food, I realized that they forgot my crab ragoon. My rice was undercooked, and the chicken had blood specs in the middle. The sweet and sour sauce literally tasted like human blood. I was very disappointed with my food. Once I told the people, they refused to give me a refund. I don't recommend anyone on earth to buy this nasty, and inhuman food! I'm sick to my stomach 😷🤢

name: Cassie Hunt
text: I ordered delivery.I had read some good reviews. My rice was undercooked and very under seasoned. My chicken was okay but not fantastic. And the fried shrimp I ordered for my son tasted like it came from the frozen food section of the grocery team. I feel like a paid lot of money for very lackluster food. I will not order from here again.

name: Francois Huynh
text: I eat here every other day. Chicken in garlic sauce is my favorite. Nothing can beat it. I LOVE THEIR FOOD. I feel like I am married to CHINA WOK.

name: Daniel Presley
text: Do not eat here. When they first opened the food was excellent. It has been downhill from there. One of the last times I ate here, I went and picked up my order got home and it was completely wrong. I took the order back and they re-cooked it. When I got home I realized they had left the rice and wontons and egg rolls and only replaced the chicken dish. Therefore all of my food was cold by the time I actually got to eat it. They offered nothing in return not even an apology They simply said if you want to bring it back we will cook you knew food. A week or so later I decided to try it again. I ordered the same exact thing and they prepared it wrong again!!! The delivery man took it back across the street with him and when he brought it back, they had use the same cooked chicken they brought me the first time instead they simply battered and fried it. It was completely in edible. When I called him back and told him I just wanted a refund they refused and said they could make me something else but they would not give me my money back. So when I get off work I had to go across the street and argued with the "Manager" for ten minutes. They refused to give me my money back and I ended up leaving I will never eat here again beware disgusting disgusting disgusting gross gross gross food.

name: Michael Hamilton
text: This place is not the cleanest and don't expect a buffet. The prices are good and that is about all that is good. The General Tso's chicken and the rice all tasted burnt. And by the way if you order fried rice here, don't expect to get what you would get anywhere else. It is just a scoop of rice soaked in soy sauce, no veggies, no egg, nothing else. Perhaps the worst part was the fact that when the food came out a swarm of gnats or fruit flies came out with it. I can only imagine what the kitchen must be like. Save yourself the heartache and just go across the street to the mall. You will find better options there.

name: alaina moore
text: I really didn't enjoy it . The food was hard and smelled nasty. I spent too much money for them to give me very little.  I wont ever eat here again

name: Nikole Robinson
text: Came fast but food was not cooked thoroughly 🤬🤬🤬

name: Joseph Price
text: Ordered delivery and thought food was good. Delivery driver was nice.

name: Davin Pierkowski
text: Pretty darn good for the price, in my opinion. It's not super high quality so I cant give it 5, but the last three times even eatin there, its been satisfactory.

name: Mesha
text: This place is Soo unsanitary! There is stuff everywhere looks like a storage, ordered some sugar donoughts the lady who took our order came back out with Sugar all over her hands! That really disgusted me. Price is reasonable but the food is okay.. It's not really worth it! I wonder how they are still open its pretty nasty in here.

name: Sarah Estes
text: I called and the lady on the phone was so rude that I couldn't even place my order. She said I caught an attitude with her, and all I wanted to do was order some food..

name: Emmarose Neibert
text: Pineapple fried rice was AWESOME until I found a hair in it. Then it wasn't so awesome anymore

name: Tiara Parchman
text: The hibachi isn't fresh nor real hibachi and the delivery/service is horrible! The delivery men (it was four of them...totally uncalled for) were over an hour late and I could not be refunded my money. To top it all off my food was cold when it did come. UNPROFESSIONAL!!!

name: Andrea Johnson
text: Very unprofessional staff, ghetto and terrible service. Long wait times !! I would advise no one to order from this place. The unprofessional staff is what lost me plus the wait time.

name: Rico W
text: Nice place to eat, food good. Haven't been disappointed yet, but if I do ill post it!!!!!

name: Michaela Stewart
text: Wonderful food iv come to know the dilivery staff well becuz i eat there food so much there crab ragoons are my fav as well as the prices are very reasonable

name: Esther Muhubao
text: Very horrible place to eat, have your camera ready to record a fight. Seriously no joke, I've been there 3 times and all of the 3 times they had a fight.

name: jtb36688
text: very friendly and accommodating chinese restaraunt who care about their customers. if you eat in, you are treated with smiling staff and greetings from the owner. they give you nice poreclain plates and actual metal silverware to eat with even when you order the 5 dollar lunch special. i would suggest china wok to anyone in mobile

name: Claudia Nava
text: I got the hunan with white rice.. NO flavor what so ever.. I told the lady on the phone to PLEASEEE PLEEASE Tell them to make it REEEAL REAL SPICY.. No spice/taste at all. I also asked for some hot sauce and even that was SPOILED  .. Next time ill order from Golden Bowl there you get the lunch special with egg roll and soup for 7.95 and its actually GOOD. Thumbs down.. will never order from here again.

name: Chase Sims
text: The food is great and I know there's bad reviews but this place is off the hook! If you dine in they prepare the food on an amazing looking dish that will make you feel special! The customer service is a solid 10/10 with the co-owner being super funny when she's scared or super busy and it's so hilarious :D The head manager is a great guy and treats people like family right when they walk in so if you get greeted by him you will have a nice smile on your face! All in all this place deserves a chance to be put on the map despite its reviews(it could fix a few things though) like; the fruit flies and no buffet (this is most likely due to the business) and some minor personal nidbits of mine. Order take out, delivery or even dine in! It's worth it! Oh did I mention low prices? :O

name: Ascoop Autumn01
text: Very good and great service from the cashier and the waiters. Can't wait to come here again.

name: Anthony Guzman
text: Dont even try it!! Not worth your time

name: Isaiah Evans
text: delicious food it was most taisty i will definitely eat there anytime fast service great respect ect  loved it

name: Carlos White
text: Good food fantastic atmosphere

name: William Walden
text:
Firstly I would like to point out that I was given a 45 minute window on delivery and it took an hour. Secondly I would like to say that I ordered "house specialty" Chow Mein, instead of stir fried noodles however I received Ramen noodles. Besides this obvious terrible experience already the food arrived in a dish that looked a lot like a lean cuisine container. The container wouldn't be that bad if it didn't taste like it was microwaved just like a lean cuisine meal. The best part about this meal was the fortune cookie, however I didn't need to read my future for I knew a bathroom was the only future I would have for quite a while.

P.S. This meal costed me $21.00 with the inclusion of a $5.00 tip I gave the driver during the ordering of my food. (Oh how I wish I could take it back) if you like this food then save the money buy ramen and frozen vegetables and heat it up in the microwave and serve to your guests...not that you will ever have any guests after this.

name: David Johnston
text: Food was okay very fast delivery

name: Emmarose Neibert
text:
We were given a 45 minute delivery window and ended up waiting about an hour and 15 minutes.
Sushi was very bland, chicken fried rice is very literally just chicken and rice, and chicken on a stick was a strange yellow in hue. My friend Taylor could only eat 3 out of the 4 chickens on the stick.

name: wayne marci
text: Typical Chinese food.  I got wonton soup with general TSO's for lunch.  the soup and egg roll were no good.  Wonton soup didn't have much flavor.  The general Tso's was decent.  crispy and served hot.  The service was good with typica hole in the wall chinese atmosphere.  Food could be a little better but not bad overall.

The actual manager shows up and his response to the horrible customer service was that the manager in charge was not the manager and that "she was not authorized to speak as the manager" yet she told me all of that in a matter of 30 seconds of me asking how the situation would be handled.

name: Drake Bradford
text: Call in your order as soon as possible. You won’t regret it! Egg rolls were hand made. Cheese wontons were hand made. These alone were worth the trip but the bang bang shrimp? It was great! The pookie roll (sushi) was phenomenal. I’ll definitely be trying more things in the near future.

name: Diane Moncrief
text: Good but air conditioner out too hot to eat but food was good friendly people just fix and I will bring mygang back. Six to ten adults plus children

name: Leslie Ledbetter
text: This is where I first ate Chinese food and fell in love with crab claws 25 years ago. Hadn't been back till recently and when I walked in was as wonderful smelling and tasty as the first time! Sweet older couple run it, great service, great food, reasonable prices and nice atmosphere. Highly recommend!!

name: Kang hyun Cho
text:
What a wonderful restaurant!!
This restaurant's roll is the best roll evere i have eanten!!
This is best Chinese buffet near me

name: Ellen Poling-wright
text: We were there for 10 total minutes, from the time we walked in, to the time we walked out.  The food was awful and the trays were basically empty.  And it was 12:17, normal lunchtime!  They still charged us full price, $19.75, for eating nothing.  Never again!

text: We had dinner hear last night. Sushi was very good and well priced. They even have several dishes and special rolls for kids. The bartender was also our waitress and she was very polite and friendly. We would definite definitely go again next time we are in town.

name: ian kornmeyer
text:
Asian Rim was across from our hotel and we thought we'd give it a try.  Overall, I'm glad we went and we would go back.

We tried the fish tacos and some sushi.  The fish tacos come thoroughly doused in coleslaw and big enough to be difficult to eat without a double-jointed jaw. They were full of fresh veggies and the fish was good.  The sushi was a Rainbow Roll and some nigiri.  The fish was all fresh and the portions were appropriate for the price.

Our sweet tea came out hot enough to melt the included ice.

name: Lee Osbourn
text: If you've never eaten at Asian Rim, grab your keys and head over there!  It's a great little place with a nice atmosphere and the staff are very friendly. I usually have the Dragon's tail(i think its called). I always like to try something different when i go,  but I've never been disappointed.

name: Paige H.
text: Asian Rim is our favorite place in Birmingham, AL. They have a wide variety of delicious food where I can enjoy Thai or Sushi and my husband can delight in a juicy steak. The staff is friendly, the place is upscale casual, and it's a local hotspot near our home. Many out of town diners are pleasantly surprised that this local gem.

name: ninalita84
text: This was certainly a surprise to find in Birmingham!  I used to travel there for business and never let a trip go by without visiting this restaurant.  Their sushi is amazing and I found the service to always be prompt and attentive.

name: Jacqueline Dorris
text: We stayed at the hotel right next door and saw the reviews of this place and figured we would try it out. We were very disappointed. Food was bland and dried out. Atmosphere was a little weird (the bartender was playing something on her phone from Pandora) that was super strange and not typical of an Asian cuisine restaurant... she seemed a little spacey. I found that when comparing the prices to the quality of the food, it just didn't add up.

name: B R
text: Ive had the worst sushi I've ever tasted here, it's a shame bc we used to love this place. As a military wife we have been all over the country and I have never encountered such awful customer service after voicing my concerns about our meal. They used to be the best but have since gone down hill with the quality of their fish. The owners need to take lessons on customer service and handling criticism professionally with out taking it personally.

name: abbie t
text:
Asian Rim, specifically the manager Colton, turned what was supposed to be a relaxing dinner with my family into a three hour nightmare. It was failure after failure, and I have never before been subjected to such poor customer service.  That’s the short version.

This is the full story. I ordered (and paid for) delivery from Asian Rim through Yelp Eat24 and, after waiting an hour and a half without getting any food or as much as a phone call, I called the restaurant directly to ask when I could expect my meal. I was informed by Colton that there was no order because they don’t associate with Yelp Eat24 at all. Understandably, this freaked me out and lead me to believe I had been scammed. I then called Yelp Eat24 and demanded a refund after telling them what Colton had said. While they did quickly offer a me a refund (which –side note-- I won’t be getting for “up to 5 business days”), they were adamant that they did in fact work with Asian Rim and that their restaurant had actually already confirmed the order before I had called. I was still falsely placing my faith in Asian Rim at this time.

After hanging up with Yelp Eat24, I hurriedly called my bank to inform them that I might have falsely been charged. All of this was quite time consuming and anxiety inducing. On a whim, I decided to call Asian Rim back again and relay to them the information I had been given by the representative at Yelp Eat24 for their own benefit. That’s when Colton then informed me that they did actually work with Yelp Eat24 after all. He just hadn’t known a third party, Backdoor, was also involved and it was their name coming up in his system. He unapologetically told me the food I had originally ordered would be at my house shortly.

But was it? No. So after even more time elapsed, I called Asian Rim a third time to ask what was going on. I was told by a different person that I should “just try calling Backdoor.” I had to flat out demand to be told if the food had at least left Asian Rim yet. She finally said “yeah.” No apologies were given and I was rushed off the phone.

Then I called Backdoor and was told that they did pick up the food from Asian Rim, but then realized the order had been cancelled. Aside from the refund Yelp Eat24 says they will give me, no other amends have even been attempted to be made. To reiterate-- his whole ordeal lasted about 3 hours from the time I placed and paid for the order to the time I was definitively told that there was no food coming. To say this place, and Colton specifically, handled this poorly is an understatement. I adamantly advise everyone reading this to refrain from ordering from Asian Rim.

text: Horrible experience.  Food decent but the service was sub-par! I went there for lunch with 2 work colleagues.  I spoke with the General Manager about finding something (I didn't order/put in my bowl) that wasn't supposed to be in it.  He basically argued with me, never apologized and was very rude. My colleagues and I were shocked (especially since we were all in hospitality/hotel management).  I sent an email to their corp. office and found out it was a franchise. The lady at the corp. office was VERY nice and apologetic for his rude behavior. I asked to be contacted on a Regional or Ownership level and never heard from anyone.  I sent another email to corp. office expressing how discontent I was that no one even contacted me.  So now I'm posting the experience everywhere.  And it could have all been avoided with some very simple, good old fashioned, CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

text: A small family run Chinese takeout restaurant that can be hit or miss. You have two options when ordering your food: by size (pint it quart) or in a combination plate that includes fried rice and am egg roll. The lady that usually runs the front desk is usually very nice. The service time is extremely quick for any order, almost to a fault at times, meaning they can sacrifice quality over speed. This place has been my go to for a fast meal for the family for a long time. Just keep in mind this is not the best Chinese food in the area but it is the quickest.

text: Great food and reasonably priced! This hidden gem sits in Rocky Ridge Square next to Subway. We ordered 2 meals and the portions were large enough to feed all 4 of us with some leftovers. text: China Bistro has decent food. It's never outstanding, but it's never bad, either. The people that run it are very nice, and they are happy to accommodate reasonable requests. If you want real deal Chinese, head to Red Pearl where they'll stir fry you a chopped up bullfrog, but if you want consistently decent Chinese in Rocky Ridge, this is your place.

name: J T
text: Had an excellent meal from China Bistro over the weekend. We really liked them when they used to be over at Patton Creek and were happy to find out this was the same owners. The thing that really stood out to me in this meal was the quality of the meat. Probably the most tender chicken I've ever had in Chinese food. Same thing for the beef. Great portions of everything for lunch, not too much or not too little either. Full but not stuffed. Egg rolls were very good too. A welcome addition to the Rocky Ridge community.

text: I’m so disappointed. Was so excited to see a Chinese takeout in my neighborhood. When they first opened they were great. But lately it has not been good at all. The soup I order is always different now. One time it will be bland, next time so spicy it’s not edible. Never consistent. I order soup omitting items. Yesterday tofu was included anyway, even though I ordered without. I ordered steamed dumplings and got home and they had not put any sauce in the box. I ordered a beef dish. The meat was not edible. Cheap, low quality. I hope they see my review and reevaluate things. I tried to explain to them, but the lady appeared to not understand, nor did she offer any explanation or compensation. I will wait a month or so and try one more time.

text: So glad China Bistro opened here in Vestavia! They’re food is delicious. We had the Kung pao shrimp and two chicken dishes. Hot and sour soup was excellent! We will be coming back.

name: Tabitha Mccostlin
text:
Saw this pop up on new places to try. It's about a mile from my house and craving egg drop soup I decided to run up before closing. It's located next to where the old Western used to be in Vestavia Hills. It's a small shop with about 8 tables close together filled with people having a nice chat between tables. I got our food to go this time but the portion sizes I saw were fair and steaming hot.

I'm not sure if this is the China Bistro that was near Patton Creek or just a common name. I order Coconut shrimp, egg drop soup, pork egg foo young, crab ragoons( pricey but def tasted unique in a good way), and Mongolian beef. Overall the price was pretty standard. Everything was so hot I actually burned my mouth when I got home, ha. The food was super fresh and I was very impressed.

The Mongolian was my favorite, alot of places have a very sweet syrupy taste to their and I could taste the sear on the meat and the sauce was closer to a savory than a sweet. VERY freaking good. I felt the portion sizes for the coconut shrimp was a little small but frankly the shrimp was huge and delicious so you can be the judge. Egg foo young had a really rich brown sauce that I loved and the soup was classic Egg drop. Crab ragoons were def my favorite overall, that and the Mongolian beef. Def will be returning.

name: Micah James
text: Called in an order. When I got there, the lady said they gave my food to someone else already. Even after I gave them my name and phone number. She offered to make me another one, but I still would’ve had to pay and that would’ve taken another 15-20 minutes. Unacceptable.

text: Delightful little restaurant! Friendly employees. Their restaurant feels very safe since they split their place in half for COVID precautions. Their food is also very good!

name: Aubrey Morrow
text: This place is consistently delicious, with excellent and friendly service. I've heard other reviewers comment on their prices being higher than others. Firstly, their ingredients are of much better quality than other places I've tried. Secondly, they notified their customers that their suppliers raised their prices, so they had to compensate for this circumstance. I'm willing to pay for quality food, and that's exactly what they offer. I'm so glad they give us another option for takeout in Warrior!

text: My family and I love their food! It’s my go to place for some Chinese food. While it is true that they have raised their prices, it’s bc their suppliers have raised their prices as well. Their food is so good, it’s totally worth the price and my support!

text: You can buy the same food from frozen food & probably better. Been there twice & not ever again I'm not alone either in this.

name: Wendy Hays
text: We ordered from the menu we found on line laying on their table, come to find out, you cannot do that as the prices are all wrong. Don’t order fried rice as that’s an extra charge and don’t order anything that is spicy. I ordered what I have been ordering at Chinese restaurants for years....orange chicken. Boy, big mistake. Apparently if you want something spicy, you have to ask for it. It being marked spicy on the menu means nothing. We also ordered Kung po Chicken  and shrimp, that is supposed to be very spicy hot , but again, nope, and it No shrimp  to be found. The last thing we ordered because we wanted to celebrate Valentines Day late was General Tso chicken, yes that is supposed to be very spicy too. Not only was it not spicy , it tasted exactly like the bland orange chicken. When I called to complain I was told that I didn’t know what I was talking about. That her cooks know how to cook their food and if I wanted it spicy I was supposed to tell them. They charged me for the noodles which was ok because I expected that but when she asked if I wanted fried rice I said yes because I am not usually charged for that, Wrong. Not only is their food way over priced,but it isn’t worth a reasonable price. The customer is never right there so don’t bother to complain as she will just shout you down. I have never been treated so rudely by a restaurant owner in my life. My advice is to eat somewhere else and save yourself a headache and a lot of money.

name: David Acord
text: Ah, China Kitchen. If you find yourself craving Chinese food in Warrior, AL, this is the place you must go. The good news is that the food is actually pretty decent for Chinese takeaway, but the bad news is that the owners realise they own the niche of Asian cuisine in this town, and charge out the wazoo as a result. Sesame Chicken at $12.50? Ouch.

name: Chris Harper
text: Very nice folks and the food is very good. They know us by name and even know our orders! "You want your usual?"

name: Ethan Rush
text: Good food. Huge portions.

name: Brian Jones
text: Absolutely terrible food and expensive prices. I asked for a slight modification to an order and was more or less barked and refused. The staff's attitude makes one wonder if they even wish to have customers at all. This is one of the absolute WORST Chinese restaurants I've ever experienced. You'd do better to purchase a microwave meal and settle than to eat at this place.

text: Very good carryout. Friendly staff.

name: James Baldwin
text: The lady there is very rude. My wife and I called ahead to get lunch to go, during lunch hours which is usually cheaper. Not here! 2 lunch plates and an order of wontons and over $30??? We asked why it was so expensive and the lady got angry saying, You order my food and now don't want it? What am I supposed to do with my food now? Um, we were just asking a question! We did cancel the wontons, paid  $25 for the food and won't be back. The food is good but not worth the price or bad attitude from the staff.

Although deserving a one star rating, I'll reserve that for food which actual causes sickness.  Location, location, location with so little competition this place would have otherwise succumbed many years ago.  ... (First: Yes, I enjoy all types of Asian food. Secondly: I don't have a beef, nor dislike anyone at this establishment. And Thirdly:  Have sadly tried this place several times over the last decade.)

name: TheTwisted75
text: It's not bad

name: Denise Roffe
text: FOOD POISONING! While I can't prove that my food poisoning came from eating here, I can say that my husband and I ate here on Saturday, March 5th at about 6:30pm. I woke up at 2:00am on Sunday vomiting and continued to vomit for the next 7 hours. From that point on, well, nothing can describe what it feels like to have your body rejecting everything from your digestive system. I was seen at my Doctor's office (when I could finally step away from the restroom) on Tuesday morning and was treated for food poisoning and the migraine that I developed from dehydration. Today is Wednesday and I am still recovering. I phoned the manager who told me she would not believe me unless she received a note from my Doctor stating that my food poisoning came from her restaurant. Give me a break... and eat here at your own risk.

name: Jenni Marie Davis
text: Friendly staff and somewhat good service... BUT THERE IS NO WAY THE FOOD WAS AUTHENTIC CHINESE... SO GREASY AND COLD AND DINNER PRICE WAS 9.25 and I've had BETTER FOOD FOR LESS ON WEEKENDS FOR DINNER PRICE.

text: This place is amazing. Due to the Coronavirus outbreak it's been rough for this place. The owner is the only person running the whole place. If anyone needs a job around the area, come visit this man. Food is amazing & support local business.

text:
Nice people who cook good food. Tell them if want something different and they are helpful. I like to order my dishes without broccoli. I ask for extra veggies in my noodles. They are good about allowing substitutes. We did a take out for Mother's Day and they gave us plenty of food.

Good dine in or take out. Located in Flowl River on Dauphin Island Parkway.

resp.text: Hi Jude, thank you for being longtime friends of Oriental Palace.

name: Bob Brandt
text: Never disappointed 😊We had the good fortune to re-discover this location. They were just the BEST in Slidell,LA  21 years ago.

name: Taylor Snow
text:
We are here twice while in town. The restaurant dining room appears to be closed forever and this has been turned into carry out also. Our first experience we stopped in on our way home. The woman who I assume owns the pace helped us and could not have been nicer. Our food was delicious. However, all of that is overshadowed by our experience in attempting to order over the phone a week later. A man answered who I assume is her husband and he was extramural rude. I could not get a word in with him, constantly cutting me off and getting angry with me for trying to tell him our order. I ended up telling him he was being rude and that we would be taking our business elsewhere, he informed me he did not care. Pirates Pizza is highly recommend on the island. Go there instead.

I would eat here again, if I hear he is gone.

resp.text:
It's been tough for everybody since this pandemic. We've tried our best to remain open, with takeout only during this time.

Sorry your experience wasn't up to par. In this area, bad phone reception is common. And sometimes, we must take orders under very noisy kitchen environment, talking over loud equipment, exhaust fans, woks . . .

It happened to be so that day. Couldn't hear you at all the 1st call.

When we called back, it was still a spotty connection. We heard you wanted 102 (Palace Special Shrimp) with rice noodles. We tried explaining the 102 comes with white rice (or fried rice). It was frustrating because of the connection - something out of your control. If you heard our voice grew loud or shout-y, it was due to the environment, not our intentions. Then you said you changed your mind.

Again, sorry it came off as a less than happy experience! We hope you give us another chance, and our doors remain open to you in the meantime.

name: Natalie Taylor
text: Love this restaurant!  It's a standard go to when we are in the area.  Consistently great good, and the service is second to none.  It won't take long for you to see what I mean.  Give it a try, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!

resp.text: Natalie, thanks so much for taking the time to write this awesome review!

name: Asad Khan
text:
The food here is absolutely amazing... I stopped by for the first time tonight... Picked up a couple of entrees and am simply surprised how great the food is...

There is no dine in service currently.... I spoke to one of the owners of this establishment tonight too... She was pretty awesome and really described the cuisine well...

I honestly did not expect this quality of food down so South... I believe that this restaurant has been in operations since 2001 and now I understand why...

Orange chicken is awesome!!! I have found a gem...

resp.text: Hi Asad! Thanks so much for taking the time to write up this thoughtful, detailed feedback.

name: Josh Cooper
text: The food is consistently good.  The staff provides excellent service and is very pleasant to speak with as well!

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed our food! Looking forward to the next time you're in the area.

name: Jim Napier
text: It wasn't the worst Chinese I've ever had but it had room for some improvement. In a pinch I guess it would be okay

name: Rainy Day
text: It may not be my favorite place, but the food is cooked fresh and if eating in, the portions are definitely worth the price. It's a quiet little restaurant with children's art on the walls. It has a real family vibe. I haven't had a lot of things on the menu, but the egg rolls are really good.

resp.text: Glad to hear your feedback! Hope we can turn into your favorite place soon.

name: Donna Marie
text: Really good food, friendly service. I've been here a couple times now, they are always welcoming. The place is kept very clean. The food is good. I love that they can alter a dish to your preference, like taking the spice out or adding it.

name: Mj Brown
text:
Food was perfect. At 5 minutes til closing the owner welcomed us graciously and even chatted with us while we waited on our order.
Definitely  going back!

resp.text: We always like to hear from new friends. Thanks for telling us how y'all enjoyed your experience with us. Looking forward to seeing you next time!

name: Mary Mareno (Petals)
text: Always good food, usually get takeout.  Generally ready 15 to 20 minutes.  Plenty to eat and good friendly people.

name: Celeste Holsombach
text: Best chinese food you can get! The owner and his family are always wonderful. We've been eating there since before I can remember and we'll keep eating there for as long as they're open!

resp.text: Hi Celeste! We always love seeing you and your whole family. Thank you so much for being longtime friends of Oriental Palace.

name: Mark Byrd
text: He makes all his own, from scratch. Wonderful experience. Always

resp.text: Thanks for telling us about your great experiences Mark, we take pride in making food from scratch. See you next time

name: Shelia Kimbrell
text: Wonderful family restaurant. Food is excellent, restaurant is clean and the owners are absolutely lovely people!!! One of our favorite places to go.

resp.text: Hi Shelia, always glad to see old friends back. So happy to hear you had a great time with us. Hope to see y'all soon!

name: Joanne Dees
text: I love this place!!  Really sweet owners, and the food is excellent!  Every dish is made to order.  👍👍

resp.text: We are so happy to hear that you enjoy our dining experience Joanne! It is always a pleasure serving patrons like you.

name: Ryan Ransom
text: First time here stopped on the way back from visiting Fort Gains. Had the Orange chicken and shrimp rangoons. Food and service were excellent. It was fairly quiet being the off season and mid afternoon.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! Hope to see you again if you around Dauphin island area.

name: Lenny Mayers
text:
It was a real treat to have such tasty Chinese food down here in Theodore. The chef and staff were very pleasant. The restaurant is very nice and the restroom was very clean. A very nice restaurant, indeed. Thank #You.
If I'm ever in the area.......
#Godspeed.

name: Comrade Salad
text:
Let me preface this by saying I have eaten at almost every Asian restaurant in the Theodore and Mobile area, so I've been around.

This place has the potential to be good, but it isn't it falls short. I ordered the General's Chicken and it came with Fried Rice and a Vegetable Roll. What I got was.... bad. I watched them microwave the food from my seat, so I already knew what was coming. The chicken has a strange after taste and tasted nothing like what you might expect it to taste like, and the Vegetable Roll was uneatable. Worst of all though was the Fried Rice. It was mushy, not at all fried and made to order and tasted like prepackaged rice.

If this place wants to become a great eating place it needs to wake up. COOK my food, don't reheat it. NOTHING is worse than Fried Rice that is just microwaved. Conversely, I LOVE fresh made rice and won't mind the wait.

Until they start actively making their food to order WHEN it is ordered I will not reccomend this place. Sorry.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for taking time out and giving us feedback! We're sorry your meal did not satisfy your expectations.

Our General Chicken is served fresh from the wok with our own recipe, and eggrolls here have always contained vegetables and shreds of pork.

True fried rice will naturally vary, and today's was on the soft side. We apologize that it didn't match your tastes. We always take good feedback to heart, and aim to improve next time!

name: Kim Thomason
text: Best wonton and egg drop soup.  The Saturday special was wonderful.  Best sweet and sour chicken I have had in 40 years. Will come back when in the area

resp.text: Thank you for dining with us, welcome back and have a happy and safe holiday !

name: Pamela Waleri
text: Food is always fresh. The eggrolls are very good. Very friendly owners. Clean & comfortable.

resp.text: So happy to hear this. We always pride ourselves on freshness. Thank you for the great review!

name: Tommy Harmon
text: Slow getting us our food. But was good when we got it

resp.text: Hi Tommy! Fresh good food takes time. You added on to your to-go while waiting. If you are in a hurry, ordering ahead is best.

name: Keith Morrison
text: I've been a customer of Oriental Palace since they opened 11 or 12 years ago. They are so friendly and accommodating. When we call for carry out they know who we are and our preferences. The food is simply fantastic and in all these years I have never, as in not once, received a dish that I was not pleased with.

name: Bill Schenk
text: Chef will adjust the entree for you, and good value for money. Curry Shrimp rocks!

resp.text: Glad you love the Curry Shrimp and our 5 star spicy scale! Try the Friday Special Hunan Shrimp, a signature spicy dish. It might surprise you. Happy New Year🎊

name: Jim Stricker
text: We loved the restaurant and went as often as we could while we were in Alabama. The food is fresh and delicious.

resp.text: Glad to hear you love our restaurant, and we love seeing our customers often too. Looking forward to your next visit around the area.

name: Richard Brewer
text: Ignore the review by Aaron Wayman.  He doesn't know what he is talking about.  I live on Dauphin Island, and I have been going to this restaurant since they first opened about ten years ago.  The food is always excellent, and the owner and staff are always very pleasant.  Like most people, I have eaten at many different Chinese restaurants in my life, and I would place this one at the very top of my list.  Their prices are no different than other restaurants.  I have no idea how the other reviewer could have spent $55 dollars unless he was feeding his entire family.  Some people just like to have something to complain about.

text: It's decent, they need more business to increase quality and consistency of the food. Excellent place to eat lunch or dinner after a long day on the water.

text: Worst food I have ever eaten and I've had some really bad food before.  The eggrolls are loaded with tons of ginger.  The hot and sour soup was loaded with sugar.  Chicken was bland and rubbery and tasted like it was cooked in a microwave.  Vegetables were undercooked.  Fried rice was soggy and salty.  The food is way over priced.  I could have bought $55 dollars worth of dog food and had a better meal.  If you read this review please stay away unless you are preparing for fear factor.

Correct us if we're mistaken, but you seem to be Friday night's party of two who ordered Sweet & Sour Shrimp, and Sweet & Sour Chicken. It's too bad that we didn't meet your standards! But our waitress, Connie, did ask you how your dinner was a couple times. She mentioned you left us plates with only bits of chicken.

As to our Shrimp Rangoons, they are filled with cream cheese and beat shrimp. Our local patrons love this recipe!

Wish you could've told us about your opinions right away, so we could better serve you then!

text:
Paid the "up charge" to get pork lo mein instead of steamed rice with 2 entrees . What they gave us was plain noodles. No pork. No veggies. Just noodles. I've ordered this in the past and actually GOT the PORK lo mein, so I was surprised and disappointed.
I don't mind paying for what I get, but I expect to GET what I paid for.
If you're gonna charge extra for something, be more specific. I wouldn't have paid the extra charge for PLAIN noodles.

the food is good I just wish they would do a better job of getting us what we order.

text:
1 star is not even correct. It should be 0 stars. I place an order online, got my confirmation email. Said it would be ready for pick up in 30 minutes. At 6:30pm, we went to pick it up and they said they didn't receive an order. What's the point in having a website that you can order directly from, and you not freaking check it? Hmm? I want an answer. Horrible place. Don't order from them. They take entirely too long to cook the food, and it should only take about 10-15 minutes to cook the simple things.
Do not order from this place.

Take your time, money, and gas to China Chef by Rouses in Saraland. Best chinese in the area and they are quick to make your food.

Called in an order well over the $10 minimum, they asked for and I gave them my address and phone number and was told it would be here within 45mins. That was 4hrs ago and im still foodless. Never got a call back or anything. Guess they couldn't find me 3 miles down hwy 43. My rating of 1 star is for poor service and is not against the food because I still don't know what it tastes like. If you are hungry take my advice and don't order delivery.

name: Juliana McMullin
text:
Great experience...

A large variety of food items, all fresh... we were there at about 6pm until 7pm... very tasty food, better than some other local Chinese buffets.

Service was perfect... empty plates whisked away quickly, drink refilled often enough my glass was always full.

The atmosphere was very comfortable.. not too cold, music soft enough I didn't really notice it.

I highly recommend this restaurant!

name: Jess
text: Fantastic food for and amazing price. They had so much food to choose from, I had to get several plates and it's ENDLESS !! I am definitely coming back and I'm bringing more people with me!

name: Dan Moore
text:
Wow this was just really bad. the only reason it gets one star is because zero wasn't a option. I went on a Saturday afternoon and was greeted by the hostess who had a mouth full of food and only said "what you drink?"
I almost walked out after surveying the buffet but stayed against my better judgment. I was feeling lazy. The Diet Coke was so bad I asked for regular instead which wasn't much better, I used to work in the food industry and it was obvious the soda machine hadn't been calibrated in forever. The food was as mediocre as the service, it was luke warm and dried out. The flavors were just off, I think even freshly made it still would have been bad.  The atmosphere was weird too, no music, just a tv playing Fox news and the hostess' school age son running around playing like it was a daycare. And I ended up paying almost $9. Do yourself a favor, go to New Century instead, I ate there last week and had a pretty decent experience. MUCH better food and service. Weird atmosphere there too and in a run down scary shopping mall but pretty good buffet.  I will never go back to China King.

name: Ebony Horton
text: Not great if you are one who wants excellent service, but the food is great and the service is 'as needed.'

text: The restaurant had personalized service with amazing to adequately rated cuisines for those that desire a taste in the Chinese category.

name: WWJD
text: Came in to eat around 2:15 PM. Okay, I’ve worked at the one in Troy before as a waitress and will say this...buffet presentation should be much better than what I’ve seen the last two times at this Elba location. I’m aware it is owned by a different individual than the one in Troy was but perhaps they should work on a few things. Nothing was labeled on the buffet bar, the potatoes were raw still and they do not keep the the buffet bars stocked well. My first experience was much worse so I thought to give it a second chance a few weeks later in case I just had bad luck that one time. The food today was OK...the waitress is really why I gave it three stars instead of just two. She did go out of her way to make sure our drinks were refilled. She didn’t ever bring us our receipt and no fortune cookie. We waited around fifteen minutes but she sat in the corner with the other cashier/waitress talking and eating. So, we got up and paid at the counter then left. I don’t know. The experience just wasn’t grand by any means. The buffet is my biggest complaint though. Need to keep it better stocked, make sure foods aren’t undercooked and label what everything is please.

name: Chris Bowden
text: Good food, but could be much cleaner inside. Also, they will never answer the phone, so phone orders are impossible.

name: Lisa Oliver
text: I took 1 bite of all 4 items on my plate. All were cold at 11:10. 10 minutes after they opened. It tasted old and horrid. I paid for my tea which wasn't good either and I left.

name: Amie Cook

name: Christine Stroup Lerose
text: Food from the buffet was cold and rubbery like, as if it was left overs from the day before. Not fresh at all!! Only 1 item was fresh! Pretty sad when we got there right at 11:00 when they opened. First time there!!Would never return again! Waitress never once asked us how the food was or anything!! Too busy on her cell phone texting! 😞👎👎The only good thing I can say is the place was very clean.

name: W sandidge
text: Red sauce was watered down, dessert cakes wear dry. Some of the food wasn't stocked on the bar. And flys where aggravating us while we tried to eat. Won't be  back

name: Anonymous M
text: First I will say that the people here are very friendly, and if that alone were the deciding factor, I'd give them at least 4 stars, but it isn't. Unfortunately the food was really gross. The rice looked odd and had an off flavor to it. The "chicken" was dry (despite being soaked in sauce), and a little stringy like, so it was hard not to choke on it. The egg-roll was mostly bread with a tiny bit of cabbage inside and it too was gross. It had a strange texture inside and an off flavor like the rice. I managed to eat a little of it because I really didn't want to waste it, and what little I ate made me sick to my stomach for the rest of the day and part of the next.

text: The workers were very nice. However, Food was cold, small selection to choose from. I don’t recommend stopping here.

name: Larry Pierson
text:
A 2pm stop so I expected to have the lunch leftovers still there.
Not bad but small selection, crab rangoons stale and nothing really stood out.
Staff was nice.
I have seen a handful of these throw together Chinese restaurants not make it long and this one has the same feel.
No soap in the ladies restroom, neither hand dryer works
I wouldn't stop here again.

name: Stacie Pettis
text:
Noon, Saturday March 2, 2019
Buffet food was Cold.
Building needs repairs but appeared clean.
Food tasted ok but was all cold or well below an acceptable buffet temperature.

name: Wolfrum Gaming
text: Do NOT come here! There is a Chow King restaurant I go to regularly that's both open more than 24 hours a week (seriously, "China Buffet and Hibachi Grill" is open 3 hours a day for 4 days, and 6 hours a day for 2 days, closed on Sundays) and Chow King is open on Sundays. The food there is amazing, and the prices are reasonable. There's also a sushi buffet at Chow King. Me and my friends have been wanting to come check this place out, but after arriving at 3pm and seeing it closed, as well as seeing the 1 star reviews of the food and cleanliness of the restaurant, I can only assume it was a sign of God we never came to this restaurant.

name: Laurel Felipe
text: Lots of cars parked in front but there were no other customers there. Dirty tables, almost no food on the buffet and what was there was cold and looked as if it had been there for a long time. The service was horrible. We waited for someone to come to greet us. Once our drinks hit the table we didn't see anyone else again. We could hear someone cooking but no food came out. We heard a baby crying from the kitchen also?? There is a private dining area that is basically trashed yet full of trays of what appeared to be raw empanadas. My husband went to pay the bill and spoke with one of the employees Apparently the owner never checks in on this place. It's managed by Mexican people which isn't a problem except that they are using the kitchen to sell street food (the empanadas I'm guessing?) And that also explains the baby crying. Their whole family is there cooking food they sell for their own profit I assume.

name: John Norris
text:
I have driven past Golden Gate for years, as has probably about half of Alabama at some point. From the outside, it looks like a pretty standard, small town 'storefront Chinese' joint. Let me tell you, it looks like that on the inside as well.

Eating at a 4-top by myself, there was sort of a "went to the early church service this week and sat in someone's pew" vibe. Who is that guy and why is he sitting at Jim's table? It was kind of funny, really.

As for the food, what can I tell you? This was most certainly not an imperial banquet for the Great Qing Emperor. There was some very passable 'double/black pepper' chicken; a decent attempt at beef & broccoli, and a few other entrees that didn't look as appetizing. The rice (fried) was okay, but the egg roll was the low point. It had a taste like they had rolled it immediately after cleaning the cutting board and not rinsing it off completely....kind of soapy. However, for some reason, it gave me some piece of mind.

All told, I have been to worse 'small town' Chinese buffets. Right now, Golden Gate is in the 'middle of the pack.'
