name: ewan yousef
text: I have eaten Chinese food from all over the States and Canada, and I absolutely loved the food here. The General Tso's Chicken and the Mongolian Beef were exquisite. The kind woman who rang me up even gave me a large sweet tea for free, you can't beat it. I will definitely eat here again if I find myself in this part of Alabama again.

name: Jose Euvin
text: Food was ok.

name: Yelah The Ninja
text: The food is good, most of the time. Be careful though, one time me and my grandmother came here and she got sick from the crab. We know it was the crab because we both ate the same thing but that. Today we came here and the chicken and shrimp was kinda dried out a bit. A lot of the times the little boy there is sorta roudy. Today though, there were two men and the boy got behind one of them and was playing peak-a-boo (I guess) with the other guy. Then a toddler came in and they started yelling and roaring at each other and the adults didn't do anything about it. As we were paying, the boy tried to "scare" me by roaring at me like a monster and asked if he scared me. Clearly not. So he told me to try to scare him. We left after that and that is when the lady got onto him.

name: Reaper Crew
text: Owners are really nice. Food is good must try the pepper shrimp. The prices are really good. A must try is you like Chinese. Oh and the hot chili oil is amazing. Which we found out they make it there selves.

name: Larry Phillips
text: Have eaten at Chinese restaurants in many places, both in the USA and abroad.  This is some of the best I've had.  If it's Chinese food we want, we never go anywhere else and we drive about 20 miles and it takes 30 minutes to get there.  We always order takeout from the menu.  The chef is excellent.  We're vegetarians and it is unusual to be able to get good restaurant food in this immediate area.  It's always a treat to eat their vegetable and tofu dishes.  We've never been disappointed.  As a bonus, they are really nice peope.  Highly recommend them.

name: Tyler Easter
text: Good service but horrible food everything was extremely dry and overcooked.

name: Olivia Johnson
text: Excellent food and great service! Best mongolian beef I have ever ate! Absolutely love it!

name: F Chen
text: I order my food from here all the time. The food is always fresh and delicious. One of my favorite dish is Mongolian Chicken, the chicken is so fresh and soft. Absolutely love this place!

name: Kim Alcala
text:
I WISH there was an option for
"NO STARS"!  The food was old (this included the sushi that had sit there so long the color had bleed through to the rice).  The fish was cold.  The only cook sat with a small child, and the cook was eating while the buffet sat as a HEALTH HAZARD!   We went straight to the counter, explained why we weren't going to pay.  The older lady as well as the young girl raised their voice and demanded we pay half and paying half WOULD be demanded at any restaurant.  We had been there approximately three minutes.  We were yelled at at as well.  NEVER AGAIN!  This place needs to be shut down!  I could write much more, but I will stop there.

name: Cecil Munroe
text: Always good food and service, quiet place too.

name: Kip Reaves
text: We always order take out from here the food is good hot and ready. The Young lady at the cashier is nice her mom is no nonsense and tough but nice. She has to put up with some fairly rude people trying to get over on the buffet. Great takeout spot!

name: Donna Morrison
text: Quick service and they are the only ones that have mayonnaise shrimp and it is delicious! The orange chicken is great too!

name: Henry Williams
text: The chicken lo mein they serve could be a lot better. Taste like something anyone can make at home. Plus they feel it up with nothing but noodles.

name: a sparks
text: I love the sesame chicken. so tender and made perfectly

name: Melina Gomez
text: Love the Shrimp Lo Mein!!! Wonderful place to eat and love going in there! It’s never a disappointment!

name: Crystal Lovell
text: Best cheese crab meat I have ever ate!

name: Patricia S. Sykes
text: Excellent food, waitstaff and atmosphere! Food very fresh!

name: Stephanie “Steph” Isbell
text: Nice people but food was real greasy

name: Stephen Newell
text: Wasn't a large selection and food had been in warmer awhile.

name: Anthony Pilkington
text: I went in for the buffet. They had two little pieces of chicken on a stick. I could tell they had been there a while, as they were dried up and too tough to eat. I waited and watched, and they never put any fresh ones out. So, when I got done with my meal, I ordered an order of chicken on a stick, to go. That's when I started getting the stink eye from the older woman. As the teenage girl brought out the bag with my order in it, I noticed she had her nose stuck off in it. When she saw the look on my face, she told me that it smelled sooooo good. I get into my car, and my four-year-old wants a piece. A few minutes later, I hear, "Don't wike it, daddy". This kid loves chicken on a stick. So, I grabbed the biggest piece and bit into it. The taste of tainted chicken filled my mouth and nostrils. Then it dawned on me as to why the girl had her nose in my bag. She wanted to see if I'd be able to tell, by the scent,  that the meat was tainted. THEY PURPOSELY SERVED ME TAINTED CHICKEN!!! NEVER AGAIN WILL THESE DISGUSTING PEOPLE SEE MY BUSINESS AGAIN. THE RESTARAUNT NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN!!

name: Derik Murray
text: It's was pretty good some of food on buffet cold but could of been real good fresh service was ok they had kid doing there home work in there where everyone was eating no to professional. But today I will try again and see if any improvement made to these issues

name: Jennifer Johnson
text: I did not have a good experience there. Food was cold like it had been sitting there for hours. The rice was hard. And the food in general was disgusting . I will never go back.

name: Alisa Gillen
text: They still have the best guacamole in town! Everything was superb from the staff to the atmosphere.  Everything is delicious.  Everyone is welcome. Check it out.  Five stars every time. Definitely one of the best places to eat with family, a date, or even solo.

name: Fresh Dude
text: Wings still have feathers on them, excellent rice, thats bout all you need to order is the rice. Poor customer service, girl at register very nonchalant, as if she dreads working there. The person that's taking money should have a smile and ALWAYS say thank you. No lies here, but remember what I said when u go there.

name: clifton dawson
text: Little small place with big and good food

name: Robert Corbie
text: This restaurant is one of the best I have visited in a while...it's the only one in my area that I will frequent...until another very good one comes around.....just bought some Szechwan triple delight that was supposed to be spicy....but it wasn't....maybe it's my palate...food is of very good quality.

name: Renata Littlepage
text: The food was always good, fresh an hot

name: Chem McNeil
text:
Decent for on the road. You can eat it. Customer service was great.

My husband and I got the 2 item special - chicken with broccoli and honey chicken with fried rice. My husband described his chicken as plastic with flavoring. It took a while to get and wasn’t all that hot. Portions were decent. It was the only Asian spot around, but we have had better. Our stomachs also had a bit of trouble later. It was not a completely pleasant experience.

name: Linda Alford
text: The food is affordable and prepared within 15 minutes usually.  Friendly staff who offer good service.

name: Jerelyn Hill
text: Very good

looks like they don't serve to the tables.

name: Chris Leckness
text: I eat here 1-2x a week at lunch. The buffer is fresh and most entrees are great. I really like the chicken and broccoli as well as the pepper chicken.

Veryyyy yummy food fast
Shrimp with Garlic Sauce extra spicy was so yumm my mouth is watering right now thinking about it!

name: Nikki Fair
text: The food I had was pretty good. Kids enjoyed it.

name: nathan koehn
text: Good for quick lunch

name: Malysa Crockett
text: The food is great, clean environment, and great customer service

name: Lauren Smith
text: I recently ordered dinner that included white rice. I ordered around 8:15. When I arrived, shortly before closing time at 9, I was told that they were out of white rice. The owner just stared at me, as if I was just supposed to accept that , take my dinner, and go.  After an awkward pause, I asked if there were some other alternatives. The owner, I guess, asked if I would like fried rice, which I declined because I don't like fried rice. I asked if I could have lo mein instead. She proceeded to tell me that I would have to pay extra for lo mein, $1 to be exact. Now while the amount is nominal and it's certainly not a big deal, the overarching principle of customer service is a big deal. The professional thing to do would have been to call me back when they found out that they did not have the specific item that I ordered so I could have made an adjustment then. Instead, when I arrived around 9 to get my order, I was essentially punished for mistake that the restaurant made. And I won't even go into detail about the attitude that the owner got with me when I raised an issue with her about her treatment of the matter. Also, I should note that when I arrived at 9, my food was still not ready, and I had placed the order 45 minutes before. If you have no other options and cannot leave Livingston for Chinese food, then do what you will. But there are much better options in Meridian and Demopolis that are far more worth your time and your coin. I don't feel you should patronize places that don't put the customers first, especially when the food is mediocre to begin with.

name: m chadwick
text: Yuck DON'T waste your money...NASTY The health dept needs to get out there

text: Friendly , clean & everybody had a smile on their faces including the customers....

text: Awesome food and evironment!

name: steve cacciola
text: Good.

name: Jamon Hauder
text: Awesome place for Chinese!

name: Marilyn Kelly
text: Called in an order. They are not courteous at all. Bad customer service.

name: Daltrina Ormond
text: Great food

name: Frog Price
text:
Place was VERY CLEAN. Tables, chairs, walls and floors were spotless as were the bathrooms.

After getting beverages and ordering we waited about four minutes for appetizers, hot and crispy egg rolls, much too hot to touch or eat. We sauced up our plates and waited for them to cool. They were delicious.

As we finished those the entrees came out. Ash hot steamed veggies with beef in a brown sauce in white rice. The plate was alive with color. The veggies framed the beef that was layer out like flower petals. I switched some before it was on the table. It was very good. The sauce was savory with hints of ginger and soy.  Ashley said the veggies were crispy and full of flavor. The blend and balance if flavors was most pleasant according to her.
My selection was sesame chicken with fried rice. Plenty is the first word to describe the plate. Much more than I could eat, I knew, from the start. I piled the rice then dished the chicken and sauce on top a little at a time. The sauce was sweet and gentle. It tasted of honey but I'm not sure.
We had enough for another meal today at lunch. Scrumptious twice.

name: Teakeyman
text: What a great hidden gem. We were in town doing some shopping at Grand River and was looking for something different. Came across this place and they offered sit down dining. We ordered off the menu that was extensive in choices  and the food was prepared fresh brought to the table. The portions were larger then expected for the small amount they charged. The taste and flavor was superb. The staff was overly attentive and so kind and patient. Whenever we are back in this area we will surely return and eat here again.

name: Kimberly Caldwell
text: Tried them for the 1st time, and all I can say is, y'all DESERVE your 5 star rating. Immaculate, beautiful interior, friendly, and food was AMAZING! 😋

name: Michael Silvosa
text: Small, quaint restaurant. Food was dank, waitress was nice.

name: DrFoxx
text: Great place to grab lunch when on break or just passing through.

name: Dana McLemore
text: Great place to eat! The service here is awesome! The restaurant is very clean! Cashiers are super nice! Food is piping hot! Rice is delicious! Shrimp is freaking super delicious! I have ordered from this place several times and never have been dissatisfied! Makes my mouth water just thinking about it!

name: Jim Hannah
text: Actually 4.5 stars. Drive thru service was prompt and polite. Received food quickly. Steak and Shrimp dis was very tasty, the shrimp and steak were tender. The fried rice was also good. Now for the negative, food was barely warm and we were consuming it within two minutes as we ate in parking lot. Amount of steak and shrimp was less than generous as was the sauce which I suspect was the source of the great taste. Too bad they aren't providing dine in right now. I suspect my issues would have been promptly resolved. I'll be back if they ever open dine in.

name: Ashley Hunter
text: Awful customer service. Dining and Bathrooms are closed. Went into the bathroom and was literally yelled at by staff members. However, the two staff members were sitting at a table next to each other without a mask in the dining area. Corporate needs to definitely get their Employees in order. Customer service at Panda needs to drastically improve.

name: Laurie Watson
text: The friendly customer service is what makes this place one of my favorite places to get take out. Every time I come it doesn't matter the employee serving me at the window. They are always happy and eager too serve me. The service is quick which I also love since I come here on my lunch break. Keep up the good work.

name: tiffany benefield
text: The drive thru is super fast for a Chinese restaurant and that's a good thing. The food is always good & the employees are always nice.

name: Albert Enchia
text: Today there was a mistake with my order, I called Panda Express to find out what could be done. I spoke with Rania a manager and she let me know fixing my issue wasn't a problem; I headed back to Panda Express and Rania was very welcoming, friendly and made me feel like a valued customer as my order was fixed. I mentioned to Paige (the drive-through cashier) "I like her" (meaning Rania) and Paige surprisingly said to me "everybody likes Rania". After Paige mentioned that I felt I had to leave a review...I will definitely order again from Panda Express and will let people know they should buy from Panda Express, thanks.

name: Victoria Lish
text: I only gave it 1 star because I can't give it negative stars. It not even the food that is bad it's the attitude and rudeness of the employees. Mainly a girl named Lauren and Gloria the manager I spoke to today. She kept interrupting me as I was trying to explain and ask how she knew how I felt about being disgusted and disappointed in the service me and my daughter get. The first time it was someone swinging our food in the bag as they were carrying it to the car as we had to wait for it. Then today it was just plain attitude from the employees. If you can't handle working with the public find another job where you don't have to deal with people !!!

name: Jeremy Elliot
text: My experience here was nothing less than horrendous. Came in to pick up an order and when questioned about a mask, I explained my medical condition and asked if it could be handed outside. Then as Im walking out I hear them say "Go on with that COPD". Exact words. I will NEVER go to a restaurant that humiliates their customers.

name: Mary Sisco
text: Like it more when it first opened here. Only had one bad experience with my food order not the food. Food was good.

name: Monica Mauk
text: LOVE the supergreens and brown rice.  Very fast & you can eat healthy at Panda Express.  The Walnut Shrimp and Chowmein  are two of my favs. Maybe not as healthy. Still beats any fast food out there.

name: Tiffany Wallace
text: This is horrible. Save your time and drive to the one in Madison. For this location to be brand new it is absolutely ridiculous. After spending nearly 30 minutes in line because I’m stuck once I get in the line I find out they are out of half their menu items. The food was not hot. Food tasted old and overly salty. They didn’t have what I wanted so I got rice instead and it was crunchy and not edible. Someone really needs to get a hold of this location. Very sad at how new it is and how exciting it was to finally have something new in Athens and it is absolutely horrible. If I could rate 0 I definitely would. I truly hope management is under evaluation and someone will step in and turn this place around soon.

name: Miranda Turner
text: Decided to give it a try as I have never had Panda Express.  The employees were nice and the large drink is huge. The food not so good. The first time I had the beef and broccoli.  Very little beef and a lot of broccoli and the rice was dry.  Decided to give it another try, with the teriyaki chicken.  Hardly any flavor on the chicken and the rice dry and tasteless.  I think I’ll stick with the local Chinese restaurant.

name: Lane Martin
text: Always good food. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you're satisfied with your order.

name: Thomas Castor
text: Had the teriyaki chicken, asked twice for the sauce to put on it. We were parked to wait on my wife's order. When they brought out the food there was no sauce had to go to the drive-thru and ask again.  Food containers were put in the bag haphazardly and juice from wife's meal was everywhere.  Food was okay but very disappointed overall.

name: Matt Sharp
text: Egg rolls are absolutely awful. Borderline inedible. Everything else average to mediocre.

name: Gene Evans
text: Great service.  One of the kids favorite  places! Food is very good for "fast food ".

name: Ford Fam
text: Food is good but the drive thru is one of the slowest in town. And not sure why because the dining room isn't open.

name: Breauna Waldrep
text: I LOVEEE panda in Athens ! I normally go during the day while my kid is in school just so I don’t have to share, food is DELICIOUS! But it’s been dinner as well and even my picky children love it !  Great staff always sweet and friendly as well. Keep up the great work !

name: Abby Kirk
text: Every time I come here around 8 (30 minutes before they close), they tell me they have limited options. You're open for 30 more minutes, so you should still be cooking food. They were "out" of the shrimp tonight, and that's the only thing I get there, so I ended up wasting my time.

name: Erika Blaydes
text: Food is great and fast service! They run out of the kung pao chicken alot at around 7:30 and wont make more.

name: Willy W.
text:
Would not sell food 15 minutes before closing.
Why do you list closing at 8:30 when in fact you close and clean at 8:00??????
Told me only had single serving of this and single serving of that.
I asked if they would cook if I got whole cooked portion said no, we're already cleaning.
Change you hours and sell until last minute.
Terrible.

name: D.A. Slinkard
text: I watched as a manager told a customer to pull up her mask even though another employee, not even 15 feet away, had his mask down. I couldn't help the hypocrisy so I pointed it out to the manager who seemed shocked to turn around and see the employee with their mask hanging down below his nose. Food and service was nothing to write home about.

name: LaDana Burrell
text: Panda is great but we're really disappointed that sweet fire chicken has been discontinued, probably won't eat here as much now honestly bc that was my family's favorite.

name: Aldo Bennigsohn
text:
Great food served hot! Packaged well
Fast drive through.

name: De'Erica B.
text: Saw all the bad reviews and still decided to give them a try (BAD IDEA)!!!!! The reviews are right. I have a 30 minute lunch and was in the line for about 20 out of those 30 minutes. My food wasn’t hot, it wasn’t even warm. I specifically asked the girl for extra sauce on the speaker and she confirmed with me. I made it back to my job and noticed I didn’t have any sauce. Then, they have a sign on the door saying the inside is open but they have the doors locked. HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE! 0 out of 10 would not recommend! READ THE REVIEWS! It’s sad because they just opened.

name: kk vogls vibes
text: Great food, friendly People!! Panda Express is one of my favorite places!! So happy we finally got one in Athens!! Keep up the great work guys!!

name: sabrina bates
text: So good, so quick.  I've never had to wait long and the food has been great every time.  Workers are very friendly.

name: Andrew
text: I'm not sure if this counts as Chinese food, but its quick.

name: game smasher
text: I will not be returning to this location!!!! This store needs training from the store in Madison. I ordered a bigger plate with rice, what should have been beef and broccoli, and beijing beef. Okay the beef looked like steamed chicken and the broccoli wasn't even cooked and on top of that they only give me one (1) pack of soy sauce with a plate full of dry rice. Now Panda in Madison they don't  half step never have had a problem with their service. That's why it's good to stick to what you know. $10 wasted on food😡😡😡😡😡😡

name: Jacob McElyea
text: I am so excited to finally have a Panda Express  location in Athens! Every location I’ve been to have been consistent with the quality of the food, and this location is no exception! I ordered the family feast which includes 3 large entrees and 2 large sides for $34 plus tax. The employees were very friendly and even though the drive-thru line was long, I didn’t have to wait that long.

name: Nikki Appleton
text: First time trying and we loved it!

name: IssaJayLaLaè
text: (BAD) Meat serving size is absolutely tiny for an entree bowl. I ordered Honey Walnut Shrimp panda bowl and because of the choice of the shrimp I received a whole up charge. Then to finally get my bowl full of rice with no taste/seasoning at all, and only 6 pieces of shrimp. Thereafter, with a up charge  being placed you would think the portion sizes would be fair like half and half. The meal was not worth $8 at all !

name: Lily Chandler
text: Last 3 visits, the lo mein was dry & undercooked,  the chicken tasted old & rubbery. Unfortunately, we won't be coming back to this location.

name: Wiggins Foster
text: This place is terrible! I should have went to the one in Madison! The food was not hot and the little snooty girl who works the drive thru on day shift was very rude and dry! If your food is terrible and you have this many bad reviews, you would think at least customer service would be good! I will never eat here again.

name: Tori Keller
text: I love their food. I’ve eaten there (drive thru) a couple of times. All the times online say they close at 9:30, get at the drive thru at 9:00 & they said they were closed. Not a big deal, just really disappointed as I was really hoping for some Panda.

name: Emily Miles
text: We were overly excited when we learned that Athens was getting a Panda. We have had it a few times since its opened and every time the service was great and the food was very fresh! Lets hope it stays this way!

name: 20mattdm
text: Food was great as always I get teriyaki and honey sesame chicken with fried rice it’s always fresh. Staff was nice and friendly but one stood out I think her name is krisna very nice seems to really care for the customers. Check out Athens panda it’ll be a growing hotspot.

name: Michelle Williams
text: Everything was delicious!! Drive thru was fast and staff was super sweet!! Will definitely be back!

name: keith couch
text: crunchy rice. messed up order. food was old. one in madison is 10x better.

name: Joshua Plunkett
text: Ordered a plate and had 97% of it dry noodles and the rest celery and about 1% actual chicken in it, was told to wait almost 10 minutes "because it had to cook" when no one else was even in the drive through and everything came out ice cold. Being 100% honest if I got this food for a homeless person I would be ashamed to even give it to them. The absolute worst place you could waste $20 at.

name: Darla Malone
text: Ordered chicken & green beans along with sesame chicken. While the chicken in both was delicious, the green beans in both entrees was like leather & could not eat. Also I ordered 3 entrees but 2 entrees was no more than a Tablespoon. Wasted my money

name: Tim Youngs
text: Really glad we got one in Athens. Food has been great. Lines are a little long but it just opened, its to be expected.

name: Alan Elledge
text: Great job, guys! Best Panda in the area.

name: Lynne Theresa
text: The rice is never cooked long enough.

name: Rochelle Morton
text: Usually good food but tonight rice not cooked completely and orange chicken is spicy now! Can't handle spicy!

name: Brett Godbee
text: You gotta try the Honey Walmart Shrimp

name: Emily Shoemaker
text: Best Panda Express I’ve ever eaten at. The food was hot and fresh. Great customer service!!!

name: Alabama Chick
text: Food was hot, fresh and got my order quickly. Win win!!!

name: Greg Patrick
text: This location is “drive-thru only” & is slow.  The chicken entrees & fried rice were cold and bland.  The price & quantity of food was good ... disappointed in the quality.

name: Kyah and Mya’s World
text: soooo great the employees are so friendly i will be going again!!

name: Carlos Fletcher
text:
We were so excited that Panda Express was coming to Athens! I didn’t go when it first opened because they were so busy the first week. Went on a Friday eve about 4! Food looked as it had been sitting there since lunch
But I tried it anyway. So disappointed fir my first experience, the honey chicken and firedd as ide chicken was cold and taste doughy and the chow mein  was bland and dry! Y’all a restaurant can be new but must have good cooks! We want y’all to stay please do better, I don’t want to have to keep drive to Madison

name: Keyome DT
text: First of all. If your sign says open.  That means your open. You can not ask me about my mask first of all. Second, dine in not allowed? I hope all these businesses go out of business.

name: James Adams
text: How about opening the dining area for take out orders instead of having your drive thru only with traffic backed into highway 72. You’d think a new location would be prepared.

name: Christopher Moore
text: Staff was very rude, food was OK but not so fresh. I will not dine at the Athens location again.

name: Daniel Ibsen
text: Very fast efficient friendly and the orders are always correct

name: Pamela Baldo
text: Service was fast but unfortunately our spring rolls were frozen in the middle.... Also, broccoli and beef was mostly broccoli with a few pieces of meat.

name: Renee Hardy
text: This place has the bomb  orange chicken!

name: james wells
text: Let’s not turn the bag sideways when handing it out. Makes a mess every time.

name: Alexandra Taylor
text:
If I could give less I would!!
Me, my husband, and 15 month old just got food poisoning after eating there on 1-20-2021. I called to let the manager know what was going on and she would not give me her name and told me there was nothing she could do it about it. Whatever you do, don’t go to this panda!!!

text: Love this place!!!  The food was amazing!  Hot and delicious!  Caroline was our Waitress and she was fantastic!  Make sure she’s your waitress and make sure you try those egg rolls!!!

name: kaitlyn Jones
text: The waitress was very good at keeping our drinks full and checking on us and some of the food was good but could of potentially been better it was mainly dried out so it lacked a lot of flavor probably wouldn’t come back here but it wasn’t bad but wasn’t great especially for my first time here .

The best Chinese restaurant in Moulton Hands down. The owners of this restaurant have always been super friendly and helpful. Especially during these uncertain times.
If you're looking for some amazing american chinese food, look no further. I can't pin point anything on the menu because it's all good. So, feel free to stop in or stop by the drive thru. You definitely  won't be disappointed.

On another note I watched one of the ladies scratch her face and she wasn't wearing any gloves and then she touched my food. That's disgusting.

text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE this place! 😍 They always have a nice variety of menu items to choose from. Sesame Chicken is my favorite! 💜 Great food and good prices. The staff is always nice and friendly. A great family owned and operated restaurant! 🤗 Our entire family loves Chongwag Express! ♥️

text: I am giving this place 5 stars only because it's apart of my childhood. It does have the best tasting fried rice in town as well as best egg rolls in town...I won't say the most sanitary or healthy...but I'm still living,so hey.

text: This is sort of a 'hidden gem'... AMAZING FOOD... LOVE the Egg Rolls and the Chicken Fried Rice is THE BEST EVER!!! Looking forward to going back and trying different items!!! This place is a MUST!!!! TRY IT AND YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!!!!!

Manager was honest about tuna. She didn't have to tell me that the tuna people are selling is not good quality. I thank her.she even took sushi off her menu. I go back when the quality is good

text: Their egg rolls use to be the best,  however the quality of them have gone down, size and flavor. The people who work there ars not pleasant at all and are very short in their actions or speech with the customers. They are not seemingly clean either.  I won't be returning. I could not rate without giving a star,  that's the only reason they received a star from me.

text: The food at this place has changed it use to be so good. The shrimps in the shrimp fried rice are smaller than salad shrimps I will not be going back.

name: GUSTAVO GUERRERO HERNANDEZ
text:
(Translated by Google) A very quiet park in Mobile Alabama

(Original)
Un parque muy tranquilo en Mobile Alabama

name: Ok Xack
text:
I ordered delivery, they got my first order wrong they said they would make another correctly and deliver it again. I waited an hour and a half to call back for them to basically tell me they forgot to remake my order and had to wait another 45 minutes to an hour for them to bring the correct order.
The food isnt bad but the service is next to nothing.

name: Giselle Carney
text: Sooo good I love this food !! 🤩

name: Jesse Randall
text: Food is always great, portions are generous. Price is reasonable and delivery is on point sometimes as quickly as 20 minutes the food will arrive at our house with a 😃 smile!

name: Donna C.
text: The sweet and sour chicken is delicious, the chicken fried rice has a ton of yummy chicken in it, and the eggrolls are crispy and tasty. Delivery is fast and polite (you can order through their website). They take covid safety seriously so I appreciate that!

name: Chris Delorenzo
text:
Ordered and waiting 75 minutes to get delivered. Its sunday night, so typically a slow night. As I started to eat, I encountered several bites that had BONES.

Buyer beware

name: Tiffany McClellan
text:
5 star experience for my first time ordering their delivery! Lots of food in their lunch specials. I got sesame chicken and chicken chow mein and it was enough for 2 adults and 2 kids, with some leftover.

I was impressed with the delivery driver also. He was kind and got here without needing extra directions!

name: Jus Redd
text: This was my first  and last time visiting this restaurant. The food was horrible!! Do not waste your time and hard earned money on this place..

name: Cliff Edwards
text: I normally don't do reviews but this is necessary. I've had Chinese food from many different places all over the country and this is the worst food ever. I ordered nearly $50.00 worth of food and it was all horrible. The beef was burned, the egg rolls were over cooked, the chicken wings were burned and cooked in old overused oil. Even the wonton soup was terrible. Absolutely unbelievable 👎

name: Dean Pullin
text: This is our go-to Chinese food delivery restaurant.  The food is consistently excellent and delivery is quick.  I’m not sure why they don’t have better reviews.  We have been eating here for almost 4 years.  I guess more people who are dissatisfied are more apt to leave poor reviews.  Too bad, because the egg drop soup, house fried rice, and spicy chicken dish are among our favorites.

name: Debbie Ireland
text: Great food and fast delivery.  We order here from work quite a bit and the food never takes long to get there and is always hot and delicious.  Love their Mongolian Shrimp.  Hot and Sour soup is awesome too.  Highly recommend!

name: Sharon Payne
text:
Ordered lunch today..Chicken and broccoli and Three delicacies. Asked for my food to be made spicy.  when I opened Chicken and broccoli the chicken was as white as Styrofoam and it wasnt spicy at all. I have never had it to look like this and I order from here alot. When I called to ask about it I was told I have to ask for brown sauce. Never been told that before.
Bad customer service..

name: Lindsey Motes
text: Just moved here and me and my husband decided to try this place. We ordered the general tso and orange chicken and let me tell you it was so unbearably spicy we could not eat it. We ended up throwing it out. If you are sensitive to spice I suggest trying something else. We will not be ordering those two things again!🥵

name: David White
text: The general tso's is 🔥 in every way! Definitely not the same recipe as everywhere else, but delicious! Be sure to get the homemade spicy mustard for your eggrolls too. Did I mention these guys deliver super fast...

name: Chris Delorenzo
text:
Ordered and waiting 75 minutes to get delivered. Its sunday night, so typically a slow night. As I started to eat, I encountered several bites that had BONES.

Buyer beware

name: Jeruscha Gaubert
text: Steamed rice made to perfection. Delivery lady had a great attitude. Overall great price for what you get. Thank you

name: Amber Burgett
text:
Seriously some of the best Chinese food I’ve ever eaten😋! And I love that they deliver! And they are always super polite 🙂

Definitely a must try if you love Chinese!

Edited to add: I had ordered delivery and when I called they were obviously super busy. When I got my order I was short the rice. I called them back and after apologizing profusely, they brought me my missing rice, getting to my apartment with it very quickly. Very impressed with the level of customer service!

name: Alabama Jenny
text:
Never a bad meal. Always fresh and hot. We love the chicken fried rice, Sesame Chicken and egg rolls. Owners and operators so courteous. We have been customers since they were Hunan Express, Yo express and now Beijing.

*My reviews are authentic.

name: Kahlil Baker
text: This may have been the best chicken lo mein ever!

name: Share Events
text: My wife and I travel through Hoover frequently.  And every time we stay over night we order from Beijing Express!  They have very good sweet & sour pork.  But the thing that is awesome is the General Tso's chicken!!  As mentioned by others, their delivery is always fast.  And on occasion the delivery comes by way of an Asian Lady, who's establishment I believe the restaurant is.  You can't go wrong with this Chinese Delivery!

name: joe musulman
text: GREAT FOOD GREAT SERVICE GREAT STAFF. CHECK IT OUT

name: Jesse Randall
text: We have picked up and had food delivered several times.  We have never had any issues either way.  The food is good and hot. Portion sizes are generous. The guy that works the counter will give you a time estimate that's spot  on. Some of these reviews make me think they are talking about a different restaurant or have unrealistic expectations.

name: Katha Stanley
text: Put order in by 4:30 and didn't receive until after 6. Food was just warm. My son and I got same entree but one spicy and other med. Spicy. Got 2 different size containers and didn't specify in English what was what.  Crab Rangoon was very tasty.

name: Brianna Yob
text: I have ordered from this place several times and have received good food and good service. I ordered today and it will be the last time. I ordered chicken chow mein and when I opened the container it was a box full of mushy noodles and huge chunks of mushrooms and onions. I started picking through the mush and found a black hair in it. I knew that this was not my hair since it is long and brown. My boyfriend went to take it back and they told him that they will not take it back or offer a refund. He came back with the nasty food and a ($1) cup of complementary noodles that were cold. I do not recommend eating here or giving these people your money because you will not always receive what you order.

name: Chelsey Jones
text: While I am not a huge fan of chinese food, My husband has been enjoying your food since we moved here almost 3 years ago. Fast delivery, and delivery orders taken 40 mins to close are met with appreciation for business, not attitude. I have picked food up several times, and everyone is so nice, and they always make sure to repeat the order back. I appreciate feeling appreciated.

name: Brittany M.
text: I placed a huge order over the phone and they were very efficient. Everything was perfect and the food was outstanding!! The people are friendly, delivery was fast, and you can't beat the price for the lunch specials.

name: Ma'rie h
text: Ordered online - when I returned home, I was shorted 1 soup & instead of sechzuan beef, I got chicken.  Not only was it not spicy, it had no determinable seasoning that I could taste. The Mongolian beef & eggrolls were good, & the hot & sour soup was better than average.  I will stick to soup here.

name: Jennifer Jackson
text: The worst Chinese Food I've ever had.. Ordered sesame chicken with fried rice and egg roll. Smh.. What the hell I just ordered from Beijing Express. I can say it was a waste of money. I do know this they will not ever get my money ever AGAIN!!

name: Ashley VanScyoc
text: We love the convenience of the delivery! Easy online ordering and good food. It's definitely our go-to!

name: alyjah Royalty
text: The food here is amazing! the white American guy at the counter can be a little smart-ass and ornery but to me the food is the most important thing. That's the first place I think of anytime I want Chinese. They also deliver and if you're lucky you'll open the door to a little hot body redhead named Amber. You like to see her coming cuz she's got your food and you're hungry. BUT you'll REALLY LOVE watching her go!!

name: Rider 0401
text: We recently found out that they deliver so we gave them a try (with kids it's hard for us to go out to dinner during the week).  We have ordered several times now and the food is always fresh, delicious and hot!  They are always on time and the staff is fantastic!  No more pizza for us!

name: AccosiasEase
text: It's an ok place for Chinese food. The older lady who delivers is the best. She's always happy and smiling.

name: Erica Cotter-Holloway
text: Best Chinese on this side of town

name: Irem Ozay
text: Visiting from a long cross-country road trip, called this place for a quick dinner. The delivery man brought it up to our hotel room, was very friendly, and the food was one of the best Chinese dishes we've had! We got the sweet and sour chicken, lo mein, fried rice, and beef and broccoli. Really good :)

name: Nina Thompson
text: Sesame chicken is on point. ..no fake red sauce on this!  I love it and the Mongolian beef is pretty good as well. .my first time here. .but will definitely will be back! !

name: LeeAnne
text: I don’t give five star ratings unless it’s earned! Haven’t eaten here in years, not sure what you changed but omg the food is so good! I ordered after 2pm on a week day and was scared it would be cold and greasy... NO.... so hot that I burned my tounge eating soup not testing temp....it’s ok worth it... I bought dinner portion and it’s more than enough for 2...garlic chicken so perfect... u taste the fresh garlic not powder!!!! Crab rangu with actual crab u see and taste .... not just a dab of cream cheese that fries out ..... so delicious!!!! Beef low mein ....perfect perfect perfect and donuts for dessert!!!!! We just found our next favorite Chinese Restaurant... like I said I moved out of town for years and came back... really wanted Chinese after being sick 😷 for days!!! Give them a try. The delivery lady I think probably cooked everything herself!!!! So perfect 👌🏻! Only complaint is it’s easier just to call and order than order online! Don’t waist your time... just call them! So pleased! Keep up the great cooking!

name: Zachary Tatom
text: Beijing Express has good Chinese food that really is quick, whether you stop in to pick up an order or get delivery.  The prices are good and the online ordering is really convenient.

name: Raeann Donnenwirth
text:
It has been over an hour since I've ordered and my food has not shown up. They are less than a mile from my apartment. I tried to call and check on my order, but the woman who answered the phone simply told me "it's on the way" without even asking my name or anything to confirm the order. She was very rude, following that statement with "okay bye."

Edit: Changed to two stars; the woman who brought the food (after almost an hour and a half) was very friendly and apologetic. The food was good.

name: jeff lentz
text: I thought I ordered beef... apparently I ordered the Mongolian onion. The few pieces of beef I got were pretty good, if you could find them through the onion.

name: Ted Dower
text: Liked them just fine and was a faithful weekly customer until they shamed me for ordering thirty minutes before close. Will not give them any more business. Have taken my business to New China, which have larger portions at a similar if not better quality.

name: Alex White
text: Food was pretty good. "I've had better". The delivery driver was a total douche. He called me and asked how far I was from the restaurant, right after I ordered. I told him I didn't know because I was from out of town, and when he brought me my food he complained about having to drive 10 miles to get to me. He had my zip code, coulda said he wasn't doing it and I would have gotten food somewhere else. We all have a job we have to do buddy. I still tipped well because I believe in karma.

name: Tha_Afro_ Gemini
text: I love ...love...love this place ....the guy thats there on the weekdays remember me and that to me ...means alot ...the food is great and the staff is even better

name: Shaquita Smith
text: The food was good but my drink was left out the bag and the reason for two stars is because the delivery guy made a little comment about tips. I had a tip for him but decided to keep it after that little remark and now I'm glad I did. The lady also said they would bring my drink but I still haven't received it. I'm not being to petty for a drink the comment about the tip is what really blew me because of the fact I didn't receive everything I ordered and he wants a tip. Never again.

name: Juaneva Heath
text: Very good & fresh food.

name: J C
text: If I could give them no star rating I would! This has been the worst experience ever, who ever the guy is taking the orders on the phone needs training with his customer service and people skills. He was the worst from the whole experience. Not only were the orders wrong but his smart aleck mouth and rude attitude top it off, I don't know how this restaurant is going to make it with an employee like that. I nor my company team will ever order from here again.

name: Carolina Sandoval
text: They messed up our order. On top of the man behind the counter was rude. Charged us extra for the sweet and sour sauce that we didn't get. To top it off the food was just bland.

name: Pete Pritchard
text:
When we heard Yoe Express was closed, we had trepidations.  The food was good just like it used to be, but attention to customer service is not what it once was.  They neglected to bring my rice with my Sesame Chicken.  When I called back they said a driver would bring it ASAP.  Never came.  Tried to call and they didn't answer.  Too bad, a hoover institution for good delivery appears to be lacking.

The food delivered was delicious, just check and make sure you got what you ordered before the driver leaves.

name: Hannah Lacy
text: Food was okay... Not great considering the price and portion size. Prob won't go again.

name: Z Smith
text: I placed an order for delivery and when the guy arrived, part of the order was missing. I called the restaurant and told them was missing and the lady on the phone was very argumentative, but agreed to get it sent back out. It never arrived. I ordered egg drop soup and got no noodles, paid extra for fried rice and got white rice. Also, I ordered moo goo gai pan and specifically said NO water chestnuts but my dish was loaded with them. Thankfully my allergic reaction wasn’t serious!! I’ll never order from them again. I DO NOT recommend this place.

name: Amelia King
text: Called in to place my regular order. They delivered an item that I didn't order and didn't send what I actually ordered. Called to get the mistake fixed and initially the lady that answered the phone said they could bring me my food. I then received a call back from the guy that took my order in the first place. He was incredibly irate and rude. Told me what I ordered according to him. I told him I didn't even know what was sent to us so how could I have ordered it. He just kept repeating himself. He said he repeated the order back to me and that I confirmed that it was correct. That is a blatant lie. He has never repeated my order back to me. After much sighing and huffing on his part he finally said he could get what I actually ordered to me in about an hour. I hung up the phone. To be treated like a fool because of your idiocy is ridiculous. You could have easily avoided/rectified this mistake but instead you chose to behave like an insolent brat. Good on you. Lesson learned. Will be ordering from Panda Express in the future

name: Robert Sanders
text: The food is excellent but a little pricey

name: Coalie Maples
text: Amazing food and they give you a very large amount.

name: Darryl Massey
text:
Great food..Guy that runs the place is a good juggler handling 2 phones an always reads your order back to you..2 internet companies a fax machine an people walking in to place orders on top of some cooking an directing delivery routes for drivers...geez I couldn't do it..deliveries are quick but on Fridays and rainy nights sometimes an hour for delivery..been ordering for years always good..nobodys perfect sometimes things get left out of my order but they make it up....i always tip the drivers that is how they make their living an they put wear an tear on their car ...fairly nice crew of people but like everybody they have their bad days too..if I had to deal with 100 customers  a day Especially some drunk ones or rude ones or some not prepared to order I ould be a cranky person to....
Overall I give them 5 stars

name: Rachel E. Smith
text: Literally our most favorite Chinese take out ever!

name: Azziza S
text: Tasty Chinese food, reasonable prices and delivery! What's not to love? 💘

name: T Denton
text: I enjoyed the fried rice for lunch.

name: S ramsay
text: Ordered here called and complained was told you live and learn, man was very curt and inconsiderate also checked my statement where i was charged extra....never eating here again! This guy wouldn't know customer service if it slapped him in the face

name: Chrisse Plummer
text: The food is full of flavor, customer service is excellent and the price is worth it very large plate of food and I’m hooked.

name: Mike Slicer
text: Put it this way. The 2nd most disgusting thing I've ever put in my mouth was this establishment's Hot n Sour Soup and the most disgusting thing I have ever eaten was their Hunan Chicken. name: Cole Wenger
text:
Oh, man. This was horrible food. How do I start?

The dumplings were floppy, doughy, and greasy and the pork filling was tasteless. They were suppose to be pan fried. They were not. These were basically only edible by dumping a ton of soy sauce on them.

The spring roll was filled with some sort of mystery meat paste and nothing resembling a vegetable.

The General Tso's was nasty chunks of chicken in a sugar sauce. None of the traditional General Tso flavor.. Just sugar. I requested extra spicy. There was absolutely no heat to it at all. Two pieces of broccoli. One of the pieces of chicken I bit into had some sort of weird bone or cartilage.

I ordered steamed rice, and got fried rice. The fried rice was mushy, greasy, and didn't have flavor.

I ordered a Dr. Pepper, which I assumed would be a bottle. It was a watered down fountain drink that had a super off taste.

The only thing that tasted somewhat good was the eggdrop soup. I hate eggdrop soup, which shows how crappy the rest of it was.

Seriously, I have no idea how this place has a 4.0 rating. Its in the top 5 worst meals of my life.

text:
The food had an amazing taste but there was very little of it. My wife and I went on a Saturday afternoon and there were no other customers. The bar was partially empty and after being there close to an hour they never refilled it. The noodles had an amazing taste but they must have been old because there was very few of them and they were mostly too hard to eat. Would have loved to try more of the teriyaki chicken but there were only two pieces (one for me and my wife) and no more was brought out.
The register worker said very little and upon paying saw that he had extremely long and dirty fingernails which put off an air of uncleanliness.
In short, great taste, poor freshness, high price for the selection.

name: Donna Wisener
text: Excellent lunch buffet and dinner menu. The food on their bar is always fresh and tastes great.  They have a wide selection of items on their menu available for dine in or carry out. Their prices are very reasonable too!  We eat here quite often and are always pleased.  The owners are super nice people and a delight to be around.  They may be new in town, but they obviously have loads of experience in preparing great food.

name: Larry Wisener
text: We have visited China Panda on many occasions. We have always been very pleased with our visits.  Whether we have visited the buffet or ordered from the menu, we have always received fresh and great tasting food that was prepared to perfection. The owners are extremely nice and friendly people.  We like to visit often not only for the good food, but also for the chance to visit with the owners. Like their food, the prices are great too! You won't regret the visit.

name: Christine
text: Ordered take out, it was phenomenal.  Probably the best Chinese/ Thai food I have had in Auburn.  I had the Masaman curry and my bf had the sweet and sour chicken.  His had huge pieces of chicken and was more meat than sauce.  My curry had lots of veggies and meat, usually it’s more sauce than anything else at other places.  They are only doing take out.  Please support this business.  Prices were very reasonable also.  We had 2 entrees, fried rice, egg rolls (2) and a small order of soup and it was $28.  Not bad

name: Yang Hu
text: Nice Thai food, and inexpensive.

text: Pretty disappointed with the food. The chicken seems more bready than meaty. If you want vegetable lo mein instead of rice, you must order separately. So I tried both the rice and the lo mein. Those were okay. However, I did not end up eating most of the food, as much as I hate to waste food, it was just not pleasant.

text: Meh. Some things are ok (Thai fried rice), others are not (hot and sour soup, tiny egg rolls, any sort of breaded chicken). Lunch prices are good.

text: Nice people good food like the feel of the place can’t want for indoor dinning to come back

name: Nicky Bravo
text: Absolutely horrible food! I requested teriyaki chicken with no onions as I’m allergic. They sent me something completely different and put onions in it. She then said her “chef” put no onions in it but yet here they are clear as day in the picture. Worst Chinese restaurant ever. Never order from here. You will not be happy!

name: Timothy Reynolds
text: A very good Asian restaurant that is off the beaten track. Hopefully they are busier than what we observed as we were the only diners early on a Saturday night. Students were not back yet so maybe that accounts for the lower traffic. An all Asian cuisine, the food was prepared well and served hot and enjoyed by everyone. They easily accommodated our dietary restrictions without loss of flavor or taste. They do not use MSG which is a plus for us. Don't let the exterior throw you as it looks more like a road house or dive bar than Asian restaurant, it is worth the 5 minute drive out highway 14.

name: Meg Fullington
text:
Picked up some take out. I had the Mongolian Beef with steamed rice and hot & sour soup. The soup was delicious and on the spicy side. Rice was nice and fluffy and I asked for a little cup of the “red sweet/sour sauce” as I like to put it on the rice. They were happy to accommodate my request.
The Mongolian Beef was outstanding! It was still piping hot when I opened the carton at home. The meat was tender and full of flavor. Best I’ve had in town. Will definitely order from them again.

name: Isabelle Kallenberg
text: I love their Thai food!! I recommend trying the red curry and Thai coconut soup, they’re so delicious!

name: Nikki Richardson
text: I always enjoy their food. It’s consistently good. My favorite is the honey chicken! They are also friendly.

name: Michael Irwin
text: The Chinese and Thai food here is the very best in the area. It always tastes so fresh and tender. Have been getting take-out here for years, every Friday night. The Thai curry dishes are just incredible, especially the green curry. They do not skimp on portions... a typical dish is more than enough for my wife and me. I love this food.

name: Frederick Riedel
text: Great prices, tasty food, friendly staff! A good spot to grab lunch.

name: Bhargav Y
text: One of the good Asian restaurants around Auburn/Opelika. I had the chefs special Thai over noodles(chicken) and it was amazing. I expected a little more meat in the dish for the price. But, all in all a good restaurant. Good place for people who wanna try something new

name: Tido daman
text: Food was fresh and was very good. The lady that seated and took our order was very polite.  I've been here several times and service is always amazing.

name: T Gilbert
text: Good food if they get your order right. I've ordered from them before with no problems and the food was great but these last few times they got my order wrong and refused to give me a refund. I will not be ordering from them again these last few experiences were very unprofessional.

name: Rebekah King
text: I have a very mixed opinion of this place. Im giving three stars only because the food is always great, fresh, etc which is why I keep going back. HOWEVER, the service in house is subpar. Staff always seems frustrated that you are there and it takes FOREVER to get your food. So only go if you are not in a hurry to be anywhere soon. As far as calling in, good luck. That’s hit or miss. Some days I can get an answer and other days I never am able to get anyone to pick up the phone, and yes- I am calling during their funky business hours. Also, if you call in, still expect it to take at least 30 minutes or more for your food to be ready to be picked up.

name: Sandra Ortega-John
text: Amazing food. Can honestly say this was the best Chinese food I've had in awhile. Good egg rolls and crab angels

name: Britt S.
text: This place is a hidden gem in the rough. They make the best coconut curry soup I've ever had. They're vegetable spring rolls are so full of flavor, you'd think they're was meat in them. If you're unsure of what to try, order the chili chicken with bamboo shoots; truly top notch.

name: Mark Barber

name: Paula Lowe
text: Since the Covid-19 started we have been getting take-out from New China when we wanted Chinese. Now we love Chow King for eating in but to get the very best "Bang for your Buck" in Fort Payne when it comes to Chinese food,  New China is the Best.  There is always leftovers for the next day and the People there are Extraordinarily kind. We've never once gotten lukewarm food and have never been disappointed. This time my Daughter decided on the Combination Beef & Broccoli with Fried Rice and Egg Roll [she said it was even better than last time]  I had the General Tsao's with Fried Rice and egg roll.  So Delicious. Can't wait to have the rest for lunch tomorrow. We highly recommend New China in Fort Payne.

text: Out of Mr. Chen’s and Lai Lai, I will choose Lai Lai every time. The menu is very decently priced. Specifically, the lunch menu allows you to dine for less than $10 before tip. Having been to China, I’ve sampled real Chinese food. Lai Lai is by far the closest to it in Tuscaloosa.

text: Always pleasant service! Food is delicious. My favorite is Buddha Delight. But everything I tried is great. I miss LaiLai being on The Strip, but it is nice to actually find a parking spot before heading in!

text:
Best Chinese in Tuscaloosa. I couldn't fund any good Chinese food in the south and didn't think there was one until I came here.
I absolutely love eating here

name: John Vallas
text: I worked here in 2013, while still in school. I've since moved around a bit and tried many Chinese restaurants, but I constantly reminisce on some of the food here. Sichuan dry pot is one of my favorites, and the Beijing Ma La Guo is incredible. Everything is good, but I really recommend something off the Asian menu, where you can find more authentic dishes. The owners and their family are great people and the place is incredibly clean. I can't wait to return to Tuscaloosa and make a visit.

name: FrostByte
text: Ordered for delivery. Just had leg surgery and the delivery guy, who has a phone number from California continually calls me, wanting me to run out of the apartment im in and wait for him rather than him "delivering" it to my door like I just paid for him to. Then the food I received was not correct and everything was mushed together and soggy. What kind of joke is this place? My suggestions: 1.get a local number for all employees if possible, 2. Get the order right, and get it there without ruining the product, 3. When someone pays for the delivery fee and pays a tip: don't make them chase you down for their food. That's why I paid extra

resp.text: Hello Big Time. Sorry to hear about your unpleasant delivery experience. Just wanted to inform you that our business does not have a delivery service nor are we affiliated with DoorDash, Waitr, Uber Eats, or any of the delivery services available out there. Since any delivery service you may have called to run your food is not under our control, we are not able to supervise the condition of the packaged food after it leaves our restaurant. We are also not knowledgeable about the quality of the customer service these drivers provide. If you'll let the Delivery Company that you used know about what happened, hopefully they will be able to make some positive changes. Thank you.

name: Juan C Gomez
text: My first time in this restaurant. I came here for to-go food. The service was good. Not too much time until food was ready. The food was unsalted, we didn’t notice something special and the kids, Chinese food lovers, didn’t like it. Usually I give a second chance for the restaurants but in this case the taste didn’t help.

name: Julie Meggs
text: Great food and service. Mrs. Lisa is wonderful. Much more variety on the menu than I've seen in other Chinese restaurants. Will definitely be coming back!

name: Madaca 99
text: Decent egg drop and hot and sour soup. Ordered Honey chicken, General chicken and House fried rice... Excellent taste, lightly breaded and crispy with white meat and perfectly "seasoned" not drowned with sauce. Reasonable portions for the price. Very pleasant service and not overly attentive on a very slow night. You are missing out if you live here and haven't tried this place. Go...this week...even if you've already had Chinese food this week.

text: I posted this just to say that, contrary to what one reviewer has said, the owner is definitely not a snob. She's a lovely woman who cares a great deal about her business and her customers. She is polite to everyone, just quiet and very formal. I've only been going to Lai Lai for a few months, since I moved to Northport, and she remembers my name every time I visit. Also, as I must be relevant, the food is damn good. Try the beef noodle soup that they serve on weekends. It's amazing.

This restaurant by far has  the best food of any where in the world! I used to live in Tuscaloosa and ate there like every other day. Now that I live in Portland all I dream about is going back and getting Mongolian beef and crab ragoons.

Also lai lai always made my day with her big smile and kind words.

I truly miss this place.

name: Laura Scott
text:
So I've been debating posting this, but as someone who managed/worked in the restaurant industry for 15ish years....it needed to be said:

Last night, my husband and I went to Lai Lai (a place I've been eating at since 2001). While sipping my first sip from my second glass of Chardonnay....it slipped out of my hand & the stem broke on the table. I was mortified!!! I lost most of my wine & the waiter (sweet guy) helped me clean it up & eventually brought me a new glass to hold the little wine I had left.

A little bit later the waiter came and brought us our check and said "Miss Lisa told me that I had to charge yall for the broken glass, or she would take it out of my pay." (Lisa is the owner)

We paid the $5, but it's really not about the money... we should have been treated better (especially after buying a $50 meal).

This may be petty, but we live in a town FULL of family owned Chinese restaurants...I urge you to think twice before going here.

name: Tonia Vaughn
text:
5-9-2021
Still take-out only.
Fast service.
Food good and plenty hot.
I ordered off the dinner menu for my youngest daughter and myself, and spent $37.65.
We each got an entree, and split an order of 2 egg rolls (one egg roll each).
Ordered and paid at counter - was told ten minute wait for food, but ended up being only eight minutes.
We fed the koi while waiting.
There were no utensils or napkins in bag - check before you leave in case you need those.
(I keep napkins and utensils in vehicle just in case, so we were fine.)

6-26-2020
My youngest daughter enjoyed feeding the koi.

Probably my 1st choice in Columbus, GA, for a celebratory meal since 2004.  Generous portions.  Easy to order from.  Fair pricing (usually I figure to spend  around $10 per person from lunch takeout menu).  Lovely structure, landscape, and pond outside makes for good photos.  If you have a few minutes, a quarter, and a small container or napkin then feed the fish for a change of pace.  See fish food dispensers (similar to gum ball machines) .25 per small fish food serving -- just inside front entry on right.

resp.text: Tonia, we're so happy to hear we're your first choice for a celebratory meal -- that means a lot to us. We've worked hard on our landscaping and ambiance, so we appreciate reading how much you enjoy it too. We hope to welcome you back in soon for another delicious meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Dongfeng Huang
text:
The chef'Lee Peking Restaurant is beautiful with fish pool, Dining Room is comfortable. It serves Mongolian beef. House chicken. Peking Duck. Hot and sour soup****** everything Dishes is delicious.

It also serves special food no on the menu. That was Asian people favored. Like: Seafood noodles soup. Special big egg roll. Sea cucumber with mushrooms****** Seafood noodle soup was home made noodles. With great chewing. Light hot spicy. It is the best Noodles soup in world. I can have it every day.

Chef' lee have been doing wonderfully

resp.text: From the welcoming ambiance to the fresh, seafood dishes, we're so happy that we could impress, Dongfeng! We'd love to see you back  in the future for more of your favorites. -Chef Lee's

name: Sy'Jones
text: The food was great! Our server told my kids to call her Grandma. Upon service she would say, "Let Grandma help you!" It was a very nice outing

resp.text: Sy'Jones, when you're here, you're a part of our family, so we couldn't be happier to know how much you and your kids enjoyed your meal with us. Anytime you're ready for another five-star experience, we'll be here to make sure you get exactly that. -Chef Lee's

name: Roxas Number XIII
text: The food and service were both amazing! You definitely get a fair share for your money here with lunch specials. The staff was more than willing to help with any questions we had.

resp.text: Roxas, you can always count on us to make sure you have a delicious meal and a great experience! Thank you for taking a moment to leave this great review. Anytime you need another tasty meal, don't hesitate to come see us. -Chef Lee's

name: Adele D'Eon
text: The amazing architecture caught my attention and it is definitely enjoyable dining in such a great-looking place. It looks more upscale than the typical Chinese restaurant, yet the prices remain friendly. I had a lunch set and food was delicious, piping hot, and plentiful. I look forward to returning.

resp.text: Adele, thank you for the wonderful review! We're thrilled you enjoyed the atmosphere inside as well as your lunch. We look forward to making your next experience just as memorable. -Chef Lee's

name: LC
text: Very good food and variety. Food was hot and delicious. No long wait times. Prices are resonable. Requested condiments given. Relaxing atmosphere to dine. Nice employees. Enjoyed the fish ponds located  inside and outside of the restaurant.

resp.text: LC,  thank you so much for taking a moment to share about your experience! Our customers deserve nothing but the best, so we'll always do everything we can to make sure you're never getting anything less. Whenever you're ready for another delicious meal, please don't hesitate to place your order. -Chef Lee's

name: Vickie Anderson
text: Chef Lee's will open their Dinning room for interior dinning June 1st 2021. You can always get orders to go. I can't wait!

resp.text: It's wonderful that everything was to your liking, Vickie! Hope to see you in again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Tank Girlxx
text: I used to eat here all the time with my dad, who has passed away three years ago. This was my FAVORITE place in the world. I just happened to look it up and can’t believe it’s still there!!! I LOVED THIS PLACE. THANK YOU for all the great memories 💕💕💕

resp.text: We're truly honored to know how much you and your dad enjoyed dining with us, and we're thankful it can bring up so many great memories for you. That said, you're right: We're still here, so we hope to welcome you back in someday for another great experience. -Chef Lee's

name: dc “dcwolt” wolt
text: Employees were friendly, respectful and knowledgeable.   Food was fresh and hot.  A little expensive but the taste was great.  I will return to this restaurant.   Thank you!

resp.text: Friendly employees and delicious, fresh food: When ordering takeout, it doesn't get much better than that! That said, we're glad to know you'll definitely order from us again, so we look forward to making your next meal even better. -Chef Lee's

name: toni whitaker
text: Great food,  Great Customer Service,  Staff Excellent,  Clean, Courteous,  Hot Food,  Great Waiting Time, Social Distancing Guidelines followed,  Take Out Only!

resp.text: Toni, it really sounds like every aspect of your visit was great from start to finish! That's the kind of experience you can count on every time you place an order with us, so we hope to see you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Angel Crosby
text: My husband and I used to eat here every week when we lived in Columbus. It is the only restaurant we miss. The atmosphere is beautiful, the staff is friendly, and the food is amazing! We have actually talked about driving over 2 hours just to eat there again for a date night!

resp.text: Angel, while we're sad you no longer live in Columbus, we're honored that you and your husband still treasure the meals you enjoyed here. It means a lot that you'd be willing to drive a couple hours to eat with us again, but, before you start filling up your car's gas tank, we're currently only doing takeout orders. But, we hope to be able to welcome everyone back in soon for more five-star experiences, and we hope you'll stop by then! -Chef Lee's

name: Derik Roberts
text: Best Chinese restaurant in Columbus. I’ve heard it’s a bit more Americanized in flavoring but whatever it is it’s delicious!!!

resp.text: Derik, thank you so much for taking a moment to show your support! Our guests deserve nothing but the best, so we'll always make sure you never get anything less. Whenever you're ready for another delicious meal, don't hesitate to place an order. -Chef Lee's

name: Harry Keller
text: I drove from Atlanta to eat here.  Unfortunately, it was take out only and no dine in. Food was excellent though and we just went to a park down the street to eat.

resp.text: Harry, thank you for making the drive out to us for some of our delicious food! We're glad you were able to make the most out of your visit, and we hope to welcome you back soon for another five-star meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Queenie Bee
text: One of the best restaurants in the whole city. Food is always spectacular!

resp.text: Queenie, that's quite the compliment! We're always working hard to make sure we're giving our guests nothing but the best, so thank you for taking a moment to leave this great review. Anytime you need another spectacular meal, don't hesitate to reach out. -Chef Lee's

name: Kristin Mitchell
text: One of my favorite places to eat.. love the soup and the Mongolian chicken.

resp.text: Kristin, we're all about giving our guests nothing but the very best, so it's great knowing we're one of your favorite places to eat! Next time the craving strikes for some of our soup or Mongolian chicken, don't hesitate to place another delicious order with us. -Chef Lee's

name: L.S. Neely
text: The take-out only process was well organized and safely executed. The food was delicious as always!

resp.text: You can always count on us to provide delicious food and a safe takeout process anytime you place an order with us. That said, we look forward to giving you another five-star experience, soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Doris
text: The food didnt have. Much flavor.

resp.text: Doris, we're sorry our food wasn't able to leave you impressed. That said, we've got plenty of Asian dishes to offer here. Hope you try something else out so we can really show you what we've got. -Chef Lee's

name: Ron Priddy
text: This place is severely overhyped. The "fried rice" is just steamed rice with egg and peas. The soups were so thick that my spoon stood up. I'm not happy at all with this meal. For the price you pay its the same quality as the side street Chinese places. Also the chips with the soup were so stale I had to toss them.

resp.text: Ron, we work hard to provide delicious meals for all our guests, so we're disappointed to see what you thought about our fried rice. However, if there's ever an issue with your meal, please don't hesitate to let us know so we can try to make things right. I do hope you'll give us another chance to show you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: Brittany Earnest
text: We haven't been here in years.  I don't know why not! The staff was very friendly and service was incredibly fast.  What was not fast was my decision skills on which yummy item to order 🤣. The seafood soup was so yummy!! I ordered sesame chicken,  husband's had happy family and my 8 year old ordered pork fried rice.  You get enough food with 1 order you can share! We ate until we were stuffed n brought 3 boxes home!!! We will be back! Really enjoyed our dinner! My 8 year old can be picky sometimes but she was full❤ thank you chef Lee's for a wonderful experience!

resp.text: Brittany, we're happy that the time apart from each other is no longer! From the seafood soup to the sesame chicken, it's so great that you enjoyed everything! We'd love to see you around more often. -Chef Lee's

name: Keith Peterson
text: We had the Mongolian beef and Hunan shrimp.....delicious, I highly recommend.

resp.text: Keith, we're delighted you had a great meal -- thanks for the recommendation! Hope to welcome you back again soon. -Chef Lee's

text: What a dissapointment the food. The mongolian chicken and the broccoli beef don't look at all what we used to eat. We got plastic ware or plates.☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹😮

resp.text: Jose, we're disheartened to know you didn't enjoy your meal as much as you had in the past. That said, if there was an issue with your order, you can always let us know so we can try to make things right. We do hope you'll consider giving us another shot at showing you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: SunnyDaysSandyToes (SunnyDays&SandyToes)
text: It was edible. Very bland. The place is really over the top on the amazing decor, including the huge dragon wall outside which is what caught our attention, but the food is not flavorful and lacking. It was about as good as freezer Chinese food. The egg drop soup was good.

resp.text: We're sad to see that you didn't love the food. We are known for having a lot of flavor, so our kitchen must have been having an off day when you visited. We're so sorry that took away from your visit. We'd love to get the chance to make it up to you and show you we're better than this soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Susie Porter
text: It's been awhile since I've been there but It's always Wonderful Food!!♡🍹🫔🍜✌

resp.text: Susie, you can always count on us to provide nothing but wonderful food, so next time you're looking for a tasty meal, be sure to give us a call to place an order! -Chef Lee's

name: j swift
text: Even though we didn't get to eat there, it is still my number one place in Columbus to eat at. Unfortunately because of the virus this restaurant is only offering take'out service. Since we were traveling, we had to go elsewhere. I'm hopeful that my next visit to Columbus that they will have their dining room service available.

resp.text: It's a pleasure being at the top of your list! Thanks for being a fan even with all the changes and hurdles. We look forward to serving you another takeout meal sometime soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Peaches Preston
text: This restaurant has amazing service and tasty menu. My favourite restaurant in the city. The meals came out quickly and the rates were economical. Recommended.

resp.text: A meal is only as great as the service that's paired with it, so we couldn't be happier, or more honored, to be your favorite restaurant in the city. Any time you're in need of another five-star meal, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Jonathan Harp
text: Open for takeout now. Delicious and speedy as always!

resp.text: Jonathan, you're right: We're definitely open for takeout and ready to serve delicious meals! Be sure to give us a call anytime the craving strikes. -Chef Lee's

name: Madison Keebler
text: The Jade Beef is such an amazing entree there!

resp.text: Happy to know you enjoyed the Jade beef, Madison! Anytime you're craving it again, be sure to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Gabriel Jones
text: Always a favorite in Columbus. Best mongolian beef ever. Nicest staff you'll meet. Always a great choice for Chinese.

resp.text: Gabriel, we're honored to be one of your favorites in Columbus. Five-star service and Mongolian beef: It doesn't get much better than that! Whenever you need another delicious meal, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Linda Willmschen
text: Disappointed that you have not reopened for dine in. Have several friends that feel that way also.

resp.text: Linda, we understand you may not agree with our decision to do takeout only for the time being, but we can assure you the quality we offer still remains as great as if we were open for dining in. That said, if you're not comfortable doing takeout, we do hope to see you here in the future when we begin our dine-in service again. -Chef Lee's

name: Uriah Harris
text: I want to know where do they pour gravy on a to-go order. Even when you eat Egg Foo Young in the restaurant they put it on the side. Bad form Chef Lee's. Also I ordered house fried rice, and was charged for it, and got regular white rice. That's my fault I should have checked before I left. Usually a good place to eat. However, not impressed this time.

resp.text: Uriah, it seems we dropped the ball with your order, but if there's ever an issue, feel free to give us a call and let us know so we can make it right. Since you've eaten with us before, you know your recent visit isn't typical of us, so we do hope you'll let us show you just how great we can be next time you're looking to order a meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Shae Shae
text: During the evacuation we wanted to try some of the local Chinese food. Chef Lee's was really good. The service was impeccable and the staff was friendly. The veggie soup I had was salty and the Singapore noodles were a bit dry (they weren't completely coated in sauce). Other than that everything was great.

resp.text: Shae, we're happy you had a chance to stop in! Great food is what we're always here to serve up. Can't wait to serve you up some more next time around! -Chef Lee's

name: Josh Mullins
text: Every time I have gone the food has been great. Expect to pay $12 to $13 for a meal, however, the portions are huge. The staff has always been very attentive and nice.

resp.text: Josh, hearty portions and tasty food is always what we aim for, so it's great to know you've always been impressed by both. Until next time! -Chef Lee's

name: Nae H
text: This place is horrible.  We ordered beef and broccoli which was bay no taste of beef, it was thick cloudy color sauce.. we got orange chicken  and that was straight orange jelly or syrup. We got chicken lo-mein it tasted like oil. The only good thing was the white rice 🤦‍♀️idk where this good reviews and 4 stars come from.  Worst food I've ever had.  I wouldn't recommend this at all. Yall failed I give you a 10 star in that. I had to give it a start to post but talk suck!

resp.text: Noemi, we're very sorry to hear that you were left with such a negative impression of our food. However, we work very hard to make sure our customers get nothing but the best from us, so we're surprised to see your review. If there's ever an issue with your meal, don't hesitate to let us know so we can help make sure you're enjoying something you'll really love. I do hope you'll consider giving us another shot at showing you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: Billy Cox
text: Good food, good service.

resp.text: Billy, good food and service is what you can count on every time you stop by! Hope you'll come back soon for another delicious meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Fred Pittman
