I ordered take-out from Chef Lee's and came home to find that nearly half of the container of my Mongolian Beef was noodles and there was barely any beef at all!! I was so furious and got on the phone immediately to call and tell them. They were very apologetic and understanding and made me a whole new order free of charge, which was very kind of them! I've been going to Chef Lee's for years and always considered it the best Chinese restaurant in Columbus but I did start to notice that their portion sizes were getting smaller and smaller as their prices were getting higher and higher.

Although, I feel that Chef Lee's was better in its former days, I really do appreciate the customer service that they have and how they are really devoted to the customer. That counts for something. Plus, their food is still pretty good even though they have smaller portions.

name: Suzie Dunson
text: Not as it once was. Staff barely spoke. I didn't know they would be closing for lunch in five minutes after I got seated or I'd of left before I got seated. I leaned it when a waitress rushed passed my table telling they are closing for lunch..my friends hadn't gotten there yet...I left. Had someone been kind enough to stop at my table and take my drink order perhaps it would of been the decent thing to do. Also the two ladies at the hostess stand seemed to be arguing..I wouldn't know what about because they were not speaking English. I could tell by their faces it was not a good conversation. Talk about feeling out of sorts...I think I will retire chief Lee's...it used to be the best place...not no more...

resp.text: Suzie, we're very sorry for the miscommunication. You should have been told we were closing soon, before being seated, and that's definitely a mistake on our part. Your feedback is crucial to maintaining a pleasant environment for our guests, so we appreciate you sharing it. We would really like to make this experience up to you in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Gary Stogner
text: Solid menu and dependable food that is always very consistent and tasty. Great service too.

resp.text: Gary, thank you for the stars -- we're happy you always enjoy your meal at Chef Lee's! Looking forward to showing you another great experience in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Hopey Hope
text: I love this place for lunch. It's always fast and hot. I always order the house chicken.

resp.text: So glad to hear you're always happy with our food and service! Come see us again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: B. Simmons
text: Good food. Good Staff.

resp.text: Brad, it's great you could stop in! We hope you'll come back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Joshua Plott
text: Usually great. Food was like warm.

resp.text: Joshua, we're sorry we let you down last time you were here. You're right, that's absolutely not our norm. Hoping to have you back for more so we can show you the great food you've known us for. -Chef Lee's

name: Miss Love
text: This restaurant has a really cool look on the outside, but needs better maintenance on the inside. The bathrooms were very dirty and they always say you can tell how clean a restaurant is by their bathroom. I still wanted to give this restaurant a try but was surprised to find a piece of hair in my fried rice.I was beyond grossed out and couldn't even eat the food.I can't say what the food tastes like because I was too scared to eat the food after finding the hair in it.I called the restaurant to ask if they could possibly have the cook wear a hair net and was put on a long hold and didn't get anyone back over the phone.I'm hoping this was just a bad accident, but it still shows they aren't as clean as they need to be, to have hair in your food....ewwwwww.

resp.text: I'm really concerned to hear about this, especially because it sounds like no one was willing to address your concerns at the time. Good hygiene and cleanliness are our priorities, and if need be I'll talk to the entire rest of the staff to make sure they understand that too. I promise you, this was a one-time thing, and I hope you'll give us the chance to make it up to you. Best, Chef Lee's

name: Ryan Hutto
text: Chef Lee's has been an institution in Columbus basically my whole life. They have the best Chinese cuisine in town and a really decent bar to boot. Their Mongolian chicken is better than any other Mongolian chicken I've ever had anywhere else.

resp.text: Thank you, Ryan -- we really appreciate the review! We're thrilled our Mongolian chicken is a favorite of yours. Hope to see you for another meal soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Dave Washburn
text: Sounds great. Couldn’t find it. Just a hibachi grill. Wasn’t open at 10:35 on Friday. Was that it or is my gps messing w me?

resp.text: Dave, we're located at 6100 Bradley Park Dr., in Columbus, GA. We hope you're able to dine with us soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Bhaskar Sarkar
text: Liked the environment and the food was very good with enormous quantity .

resp.text: Bhaskar, a great atmosphere makes the food taste better, in our opinion! You can always count on both when you're with us. Can't wait to have you back for another big meal soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Ryan Price
text: Great food every time.  I've been eating there for 20+ years.  Reliably great.  The kids love the fish pond.

resp.text: Ryan, thanks for your continued support! We love having you and your family here. Hope to see you all again soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Scott Parker
text:
“Business Dinner”
Had a small business Dinner. Hands down best restaurant in Columbus. Staff was attentive. The fried green tomato salad is excellent. The table had a number of different entrees. I had the Bison filet. It was perfectly and the sides complimented it well. The wine selection is excellent.

resp.text: The best restaurant in town? What an honor, Scott! It's a true pleasure to know the food and service alike were so impressive, and we hope to welcome you in before long. -Chef Lee's

name: Dylan J
text: Giving the stars to the real star of the show, the Koi in the pond! And the architecture and theming. Sometimes the food tastes like reheat / microwave and others it feels fresh. Great service, though. Wish there was way more of these around Georgia!

resp.text: Dylan, we appreciate the stars -- thanks for reviewing! We want you to enjoy your entire experience when you're at Chef Lee's, so please let us know if there's ever an issue with your meal so we can fix it right away. Looking forward to making your next visit five star worthy. -Chef Lee's

name: Brian Buford
text: Nice atmosphere! Food was done way too quick i had my food within 5 min after I ordered it, and it tasted like it. Price of the food (which is high)def doesn't match the quality I'm less than a mile away and will probably never go back!! Really disappointed!!

resp.text: Brian, we're very sorry to hear you didn't enjoy your meal the other day. We just wish you'd let a server know about your concerns. We're always happy to replace any dish that isn't to a customer's liking, and we regret not having been able to do that for you. We cook EVER dish when you order it. Nothing is pre-made. The reason your food came out quickly is because that is what we do. Chef Lee has created a system his kitchen that is like no other. We pride ourselves on being able to produce high quality food quickly. That is just one of the reasons why Columbus and surrounding areas have suported us for over 30 years. We hope you'll give us one more chance before you write us off for good. Best, Chef Lee's

name: John Parks
text: food good do not go home hungry

resp.text: John, we appreciate you swinging by! Hope to see you back our way again. -Chef Lee's

name: Lori Freetage
text: VERY fast service. Food was good. Atmosphere is pretty cool. Can't wait to try it for dinner.

resp.text: Lori, good to hear you were happy with your lunch the other day -- we look forward to having you back again soon to try dinner. Beware, the dinner portions are more than twice the size of lunch. You might want to bring a friend or a loved one. - Chef Lee's

name: MARIE K.
text: Good lunch special  and service

resp.text: Thanks so much for leaving this review! Whenever you're around, come back to see us. -Chef Lee's

name: Bryan Covington
text: The food is wonderful with great ambiance and service to match! Chef Lee's is an excellent place to dine.

resp.text: Bryan, thanks for the wonderful review! We look forward to welcoming you back soon. -Chef Lee's

name: David Couch
text: Great food. Nice atmosphere. You must try  it.

resp.text: James, thanks for the support! We're thrilled you're a fan. Can't wait to have you back. -Chef Lee's

name: Garrett Wilson
text: One of Columbus’ classics. Great food. Service is decent, although they rush you lots of times.

resp.text: Garrett, we really appreciate the compliment -- thank you! Hope to see you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Richard Carroll
text: Service was fast and our food great we had Phoenix and dragon.

resp.text: Great food and service -- it doesn't get much better than that, Richard! Thanks so much for joining us. See you next time for another fun night together! -Chef Lee's

name: Brandon Lashley
text: Great food for a great price. they come on big plates so you are able to buy one meal for 2 people to share! I have loved this place since I was a teenager

name: Wesley Wells
text: Food wasn't that great. Rice was bland and they don't offer the normal fried rice you'd expect. They're version of fried race is basically white rice with vegetables. Waitress wasn't nice and made me feel like I was bothering her just by being there. Only reason I'm giving more than 1 star is prices are decent and portions are large.

resp.text: Wesley, we appreciate you letting us know about your experience. We're known for attentive service and delicious, quality Chinese food, so if your visit left something to be desired, then we must have had an off night. We'd love to invite you to give us another chance -- we're sure you won't be let down again. -Chef Lee's

name: Cameron Goetting
text: Food very good, you leave now

resp.text: Happy to know you enjoyed stopping by, Cameron! We hope you make it back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Kisha Stinson
text:
Rude service and nasty food!

Picked up a carryout order and the front desk waiter was extremely rude. I had two separate orders and he had an attitude about separating the totals. I got  back to my office to eat and the food looked a mess. I ordered the sesame chicken which was really sweet and sour chicken with a soy sauce leaking everywhere. It was not sweet at all just salty. Also the egg roll was mushy. This place should be closed down. I don't know why people go here to eat. This was my first and last time ever coming here. Save your money.

name: Brendon O'Keeffe
text: I used to receive gift certificate for this place every year at Christmas. The past two times (years ago BTW) I have eaten there I believe the chicken was under-cooked, because I had a bout of intense gastrointestinal sickness that lasted for a couple of days each time. To be honest it seems like a restaurant that is past its prime and is trying to stay above water by cutting corners where it can. I usually give places more of a chance but the conditioned taste aversion I've developed has stricken this one from the list for me for good, and no amount of compensation will change my mind.

resp.text: Brendon, if the last time you visited here was years ago, I wish you'd given us another chance to show you that we are better than this before writing a negative review. I apologize for any trouble you've had here in the past, but we haven't had reports like this from any other patrons, so I'm not sure what might have gone wrong for you. Like I said, I hope you'll give us another chance. Best, Chef Lee's

name: kate langbo
text: I walked in very impressed by the setting and the restaurants interior and exterior. Obviously  I had very high expectations for my meal, so when my garlic chicken came uncooked and inedible I was very upset. I tried some of the sesame and orange chicken plates that were very delicious, however. Not impressed.

resp.text: Kate, we're very sorry for the disappointing garlic chicken. We cook every dish to order, so your plate should have been just as delicious as the others. We hope you'll decide to come back -- we'd really like to make this experience up to you. -Chef Lee's

name: David Carothers
text:
I took a New Years Eve date to Chef Lee's several years ago.
Frankly I was a bit Scared of the place because of its High Fallutin' reputation.
A Real, Genuine, Authentic, Bona-Fide Haute Cuisine restaurant.
But I was Pleasantly Surprised!!
The Cuisine And Service were Great!!
And the  Very Well Appointed trappings of an Exclusive higher-level place to Dine.
There is No dress code, to be sure.
And thank God.
The ethos of the place though, Strongly Suggests that there Should Be.
Because Chef Lee's is a Classy Place to enjoy top-tier Food, Ambiance and Excellent Service.
A Go-To restaurant to Impress the people you Need or Want to Favorably Impress.
Pricey for the common person.
But Well Worth It ...

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to write such kind words to us, David. You'll have to make it back again sometime to see us for another delicious meal. Come back soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Mary A. Thurman
text: Good food and service

resp.text: We're grateful for all your support! Looking forward to seeing you back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Rebecca Pennington
text: This is the only place in town that I eat Chinese food. Food is excellent and service is outstanding. Highly recommend.

resp.text: We're here for you anytime, Rebecca -- thank you for the kind words! Come enjoy another bite with us soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Mike Gagliano
text: Great for kids - the place is such a visual bonanza, its an event. Good Chinese food at reasonable prices. We thought the service was excellent.

name: Haresh Shah
text: Authentic chinese food offered. Service is also nice. Tastes great

resp.text: We appreciate the kind words, Haresh! We're always here to provide you with an outstanding dining experience. -Chef Lee's

name: Dr. John Hatcher
text:
Made reservations day before. Was immediately seated though crowds were waiting. Wait staff were extraordinarily delightful, fun relating, and served food hot, on time , and with a smile. I have never had a less than best dish at Chef Lee's until Sunday. My kung pap chick was most disappointing and apparently prepared with the traditional Chef Lee's personal approval. I hosted three others who remained quiet about their orders.
The unexpected disappointment for me. I was first introduced to Chef Lee's my Dr. G. Othell Hand, senior vice president of AFLAC. He was a past pastor of the First Baptist church of Columbus.
I trust your ownership will seek me about for a much better experience.

Rev. Dr. John Henry Hatcher
3139 Leafmore Court
Columbus, Georgia31909

resp.text: We're sorry you were disappointed in your recent visit. We work really hard to provide our guests with a top notch dining experience, so it's disappointing that didn't shine through. You mention receiving great service and your food hot and on time, so we're a little confused as to why you didn't enjoy your meal. If you would like to discuss the concerns you had with your dish, please give us a call. You can reach us at (706) 653-8888. -Chef Lee's

name: Jack Burton
text:
Not your typical buffet or Asian fast food place, it's a higher quality restaurant.  However it used to be a lot better when they had the original chef, but in the last 15 years they've cut costs and hired other people so it's gone downhill a bit.  Still it's better than all the other Asian places I've been to in Columbus.

Some of the staff are rude and disrespectful.

Try the shredded beef or chicken with garlic sauce.

name: April Gilbert
text: Good, fast service. Consistently good food.

resp.text: Thanks for all your support, April! We hope to have you back soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Donald Newbold
text: One of my favorite restaurants in the area. Great food, funny servers and good prices.

resp.text: Donald, we're honored to be a favorite restaurant of yours! Thanks for the kind words. -Chef Lee's

name: Brittany Baker
text: Yummy food. A lot of food for a great price.

resp.text: Thank you for the support, Brittany! Hoping you come back our way. -Chef Lee's

name: Chris Benford
text: Always packed, and pretty fast regardless. The food is pretty middle of the road.

resp.text: Chris, we're happy to be a spot you can count on for a quick meal! Can't wait to have you back for more soon so we can find you something that really blows your mind. -Chef Lee's

name: Judy Myers
text: Never disappointed. Great food and always hot. Service is excellent!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the excellent rating, Judy! See you next time. -Chef Lee's

name: Kermit Anderson
text: Love this place. General Tu was not as good last time. Not much chicken only hard fried pieces of batter. 😞

resp.text: Thanks for coming to see us, Kermit! We look forward to seeing you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Hortencia Safier
text: Carlos is a great host. We had outstanding service from our server. The menu options are way overpriced for what you get, and the food quality is so,so; mostly due to the blandness of the food. The dishes we had lacked a certain quality of zing.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear you were so pleased with the service, Hortencia, but I'm concerned that the food was only so-so -- we'll look into that. "Bland" is not a word we ever hope to read in a review, so thank you for the feeback. Best, Chef Lee's

name: Aren Sasaina
text: Great service quick and the food was fantastic.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting us, Aren! Looking forward to having you back our way. -Chef Lee's

name: Lisa Bradshaw
text: I love Chef Lee's!!!  Great food quickly!

resp.text: Lisa, thanks for your support! Hope to see you the next time you're around. -Chef Lee's

name: David Moore
text: Staff could be nicer. Food is excellent

resp.text: Thank you for leaving this review, David! We hope we'll see you back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: MICHAEL PEARLMAN
text: Great food, amazing decor, & super fast service. If you are a Chinese food lover I highly recommend visiting Chef Lee's!

resp.text: Thank you, Michael! We appreciate the kind words and support. Come grab another bite with us soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Alan Bartlett
text: Delicious food great service

name: Tamika D. Nicholson
text: Not at all what they used to be. I'm being generous with 3 stars because their Peking fried rice is awesome. I don't order much else there anymore.

resp.text: Tamika, it's rare we miss the mark on our food, so we wish we knew what dishes you feel have been lacking recently. In the future, if anything is ever amiss, please let us know so we have the chance to correct it immediately. Hoping to make up those two stars for you soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Justin Mangum
text: Nasty 🤢 Food was Cold and Disgusting...  Dirty Dishes and Service was very rude. I normally don’t leave reviews but I had to on this one.

name: Lloyd French
text: Very busy. Sunday after church crowd. Food was good.

resp.text: We were happy to give you that post-church lunch, Lloyd! Our team would love it to have you back for more. Hoping that's soon! -Chef Lee's

name: julie norden
text: Tasty, fresh classic American Chinese food.

resp.text: Julie, we appreciate you leaving this review! Hoping we'll see you again the next time you're around. -Chef Lee's

name: Misty Holmes
text: Food wasnt that good to me for the price!!!

resp.text: Misty, it's disheartening to hear we weren't quite the right fit for you. We hope all is well. -Chef Lee's

name: Jeremy Barrett
text: I've never been disappointed by a meal here! The General Tso's is some of the best I've had. The kids love the koi pond out front and the glass floor in the entrance.

resp.text: Jeremy, we're happy you and your kids enjoy stopping by -- thanks for the kind words! We'll see you next time. -Chef Lee's

name: Candace Muncy
text: The food isn't as good as it used to be. The service is fast, but not necessarily friendly. It's ok.

resp.text: Candace, we're sorry your recent visit was underwhelming. Like any restaurant, off days do happen, so we hope to make up this experience for you in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Jack Quick
text: Ate there tonight for the first time. Service was great and food awesome. Started with Spring Rolls which were quite good. As soon as we finished, our entres arrived. I had pineapple chicken which was quite good with chinks of pineapple, green pepper, carrot, and onion in a sweet-sour sauce. My wife ordered the sesame chicken, which she graciously shared with me. The sesame chicken was the best  chicken dish I have ever had at a Chinese restaurant including PF Changs and a half dozen places in China Town in San Francisco. It was seasoned perfectly and fried to a crisp without being dry. I enjoy trying new dishes, but I may stay with the sesame chicken for awhile.

name: Derik Roberts
text: If you are in Columbus this is a must have! I ESPECIALLY recommend mongolian beef or general tsu chicken. Sooo good and beautiful restaurant/decor. Good prices, especially lunch

resp.text: Derik, thanks for calling us a 'must have.' We appreciate the kind words and recommendation, and hope to see you back for another meal soon! -Chef Lee's

name: George Kaiser
text: The restaurant smells bad and the waitress was extremely rude.  Within 30 seconds of sitting down, the waitress had made such a bad impression that we got up and walked out the door.  20 min later, we are eating happily at the cleaner, friendlier Hibachi Grill just down the street.

name: Dr. John Hatcher
text: Sunday is hectic. But you can make reservations the day before and get immediate seating while others still stand and wait.

resp.text: Good thinking making reservations so you can enjoy your meal as soon as possible on Sundays, John! Thanks so much for all the support. Hoping to have you back soon for more! -Chef Lee's

name: Beau Reimink
text: I was excited to try this place as I had heard good things and the building is very cool. Unfortunately we had terrible service and the food lacked Also, it was fairly expensive and not worth the cost..

resp.text:
Hey Beau,
I'm sorry to hear that your experience was less than great. We pride ourselves on good service and great food. We have been doing it for 30+ years. So, I like to think we do well more often than not. Nonetheless, your review concerns me greatly.

If you decide to give us another try and you have ANY issues, please ask for me and I will make sure you get the best of what we offer.

Thanks,

Ed Duncan

name: Jennifer Ryan Hall
text: This was disappointing. We came hoping for the “best Chinese food in Columbus” and if that’s true, I feel no need to try other locations. My meal was a little bland for a spicy dish, and my husband’s General Tso’s chicken was mostly breading with almost no actual meat.

resp.text:
Jennifer,

I'm sorry that you were dudappointed. We feel we have earned the title of "best Chinese food n Columbus" (as well as the several national and international awards we have won). That being said, I'M disappointed that you found our food lacking.

Our spicy dishes should be spicy enough to add good flavor without being too spicy as to interfere with the taste of the food. So, if yours was "bland", we may have done something wrong along the way. Please allow us to make it up to you.

On your next visit, please ask to see me when you get seated. Remind me of this conversation. I will make sure your spicy dish is to yours and our standards AND I will pay for it myself.

My name is Ed Duncan. I am here virtually everyday. If you would like to call ahead to make sure I'm here, please fell free to call 706 653-8888.

Our goal is to make YOU one of our thousands of regular customers. In order to do so, I am willing to put my best foot forward for you.

Thanks for trying us out and thanks for taking the time to post a review.

Ed

name: Robin Bryant
text: Awesome food!!! Beautiful interior and the service was great!!!

resp.text: Robin, we love seeing all your enthusiasm from visiting us! You can expect that same tasty time each time you're visiting. See you next time. -Chef Lee's

name: Jean B.
text:
This is a very pretty looking restaurant you surely pay for. Everything is way overpriced!! The food is average and not particularly mind blowing for what you're asked to pay. The service and friendliness, particularly for take out, are terrible!!
This restaurant is run by the rudest and most impolite people ever!!! Not worth it. Don't need to be paying money to have someone treat you like you're a piece of gum stuck under his shoe.

name: Clifford Hinckley
text: Great atmosphere along with delicious food and excellent service. .. a bit cold so I suggest you bring a sweater.  Very inexpensive,  for my wife and myself we end up with tip around $40.00

name: Carly Windolf
text: Food was awful. Sweet and sour pork was soggy like it had been microwaved. All the meat was gristle. The menu is also very tiny. The building is gorgeous but the food might as well have been taken from the dump.

resp.text: Carly, we're extremely disappointed to see this. We pride ourselves on creating authentic, high-quality dishes, and we're so sorry you apparently didn't get that when you were here. I wish we'd known at the time so we could have tried to make things right for you. Again, our sincere apologies. We hope you'll give us another try, because we can and will do better next time. Best, Management - Chef Lee's

name: Alee Rassmunsen
text: my favorite restaurant in town! love the mongolian beef and sesame chicken!

resp.text: Wow, Alee, it's an honor to be your favorite spot! You know you can always count on that tasty Mongolian beef when you walk through our doors. See you next time around! -Chef Lee's

name: Leslie Stavrowsky
text: The waitress was unfriendly and acted like she had a chip on her shoulder and hated her job.  Everything I ordered here was very bad.  The sauces on the food were truly sickening.  I ordered Sesame Shrimp and Cashew Chicken, and they were both TERRIBLE.  The sauce they put on the Sesame Shrimp was WAY too sweet and disgusting.   I ordered the Bar-B-Que pork ribs appetizer, and it was hard meat, over-cooked and very tough.  They couldn't even get something simple like BBQ Pork right.  I also ordered Crab Rangoon appetizer, and it tasted like fake, cheap crab meat.  Also terrible and disgusting.   I have been to MANY Chinese restaurants in my life, and this was by far the WORST Chinese food I have ever eaten.  If I were the Chef in this place, I would be truly embarassed to serve this terrible food to an unsuspecting public.

name: robin mccormick
text: Love this place. Good prices and wonderful food. The butterfly shrimp is my go to dish.

resp.text: Thanks for the wonderful rating, Robin! I'm so happy you enjoy our service and food -- you can't go wrong with our butterfly shrimp! I appreciate the support, and hope to have you back for another visit soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Carly Taylor
text: The food was very good. I had no problems at all with that. Our waitress was very kind. The problem occurred when we accidently received the wrong check. I paid at register and went to go get my family would we could leave. At that moment, one of the elder waitresses came and said that she had our check. When we told her that we had already paid, well, that's when she started acting a little inappropriate. The difference between both checks was only one or two dollars. I had no problem paying if I had to but our waitress said that we could leave. On our way out, the elder waitress stopped us and said we couldn't leave and then we went back to our table only to hear her yelling at our waitress with us next to her causing a scandal. Everyone around us was staring at us as if we were trying to leave without paying even though we had already done so. Overall, we went through embarrassment all for one dollar.

resp.text:
Carly, I want to apologize for the fact that you were embarrassed like this. I looked into the situation and you are absolutey correct. Even if your server made a mistake and inconvenienced you, the hostes/cashier should not acted in the way you describe, and we sincerely apologize for this indiscretion. Sometimes, the comminication barrier causes misunderstandings. We hope you'll be willing to give us a second chance -- we'd love to make you another great meal sometime. If you ever have any experience that's less than great, please let me know while you are in the restuarant. I will do my best to make you happy. Thank you again for your visit and the review.
Ed- Chef Lee's Peking Restaurant

name: Dalton Coe
text: Have been eating this place for years best Chinese- American food in the area

resp.text: Thanks for your continued support, Dalton! We look forward to seeing you next time. -Chef Lee's

name: Jessika Cooper
text: Very delicious Chinese food and great service.

resp.text: Jessika, thanks so much for all your support! Hope to see you here again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Michael Carmack
text: Very good food and everything is cooked on order. Kids loved feeding the fish outside

resp.text: Michael, thanks for the great review -- we love having you and your kids here! Looking forward to seeing you next time. -Chef Lee's

name: Mark Skinner
text: When i want Chinese food this is where I go. Great service and the food is always hot and fresh.

resp.text: Mark, we're really glad you could swing by! Come back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Josh
text: For the past three times dining at this restaurant, the food has tasted great. The reason for my low score was the service, all three times the waitress (different every time) I had was very rude and always rushed me when taking my order. This made for three bad experiences in a row.

resp.text:
Josh,
We are very happy that you enjoy the food here at Chef Lee's. As you know, we prepare every dish to order.
We are sorry you felt rushed during your last few visits and that you didn't get the service you deserve.. I am going to assume you visited us during lunch.
The vast majority of our customers at lunch appreciate our great food as well as our quick service. We try to accommodate as many patrons as we can.
On your next visit, you are welcome to express to your server that you are not in a hurry. Should you find the need to speak to someone, pleaae ask for me. I will accommodate you however you like.
Thanks again for the great compliment on our food.
Ed Duncan - Manager, Chef Lee's.

name: Sharon Allen
text: Terrible,  the server was rude, the food was old, just a bad experience

resp.text: Sharon, we work really hard to provide our guests with outstanding food and service, so it's disappointing you were unhappy with your visit. If there's anything we can do to make this visit up to you, please let us know. -Chef Lee's

name: Tan Harris
text: Went here for birthday dinner during dinner hours where soup is not free and most items are ala carte. Old establishment with friendly and fast servers. Typical Chinese food restaurant. Nothing spectacular.

resp.text: Tan, while we're glad you stopped by, we wish we could have impressed you even more. Looking forward to making your next visit a five star experience. -Chef Lee's

name: Dennis Moore
text: Mrs. Lee yells "How many" before you barely enter the door. She walks to the table,  puts the menu's down and walks away before you even get there. Our waitress seated my Mother and I at a six person table. She took up all the other glasses and menu's and walked away. I had to get up to go to the end of the table to get the soy sauce, hot mustard, salt and pepper.  Our waitress didn't smile or greet us, just "what soup".  It had been several months since I was there and will be a long before I go back. Service just seems to be getting worse all the time.

resp.text: Dennis, I apologize if you've been unhappy with the service recently. We don't often hear feedback like this, so I'm not sure why your experience was so different from most of our guests, but we will look into it. - Chef Lee's

name: YPSP
text: I grew up eating  at both locations.  Now there's only one.  The taste of the food  is never consistent.  Seating areas smells stuffy.  Never eating here again!

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear your visits have been hit or miss -- thanks for sharing your feedback with us. In the future, please don't hesitate to let the staff know if you're dissatisfied with any part of your meal, as we're always happy to replace it or bring you something else. Hope to make up the stars for you in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Joe Stewart
text: Best Chinese anywhere. We eat there every chance we get. I just wish that I could venture away from the kung pau beef. I love it so much.  I did try the Mongolian beef once and it too was very good.

resp.text: Joe, thank you sincerely for the compliments! We hope to see you again soon, whether you get your usual or try something new! - Chef Lee's

name: Caroline Herlong
text: Food is great. Service is fast and friendly.

resp.text: Really appreciate your review, Caroline! We look forward to seeing you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Frank Wilson
text: If you like Americanized Chinese food (where Mongolian Beef and Kung Pao Chicken are sure to be found) then you'll love Chef Lee's.  To start with, it's a very well designed and upscale interior.  The kids will go crazy for the clear floor tiles which let you walk right on top of the water and the large coy ponds.  The service is outstanding and the staff sincerely cares about ensuring that you have a good time.  To top it off, the food is outstanding.  I've just about tried their whole menu and never been disappointed.  Chef Lee's defines what a Chinese restaurant in the US should be.

name: Kendall Riley
text: They are extremely eager to get you in and out! We sat down and were immediately asked if we knew what we wanted then she gave us about 30 seconds before returning to ask again. And when we told her no again she just stood over us like we were holding her up. We got up and walked out.

resp.text: Kendall, I'm sorry if you felt rushed, but I promise you that wasn't our intention. I regret it if you were upset by your visit here and I'm going to do what I can to make sure this doesn't happen again. - Chef Lee's

name: Sarah Ligon
text: I really enjoyed all the dishes we ordered! The building is spectacular! Definitely come visit!

resp.text: Sarah, thanks for your wonderful endorsement -- we can't wait to welcome you back again soon for more! - Chef Lee's

name: Hai Tu
text: Overrated. Don't let the fancy building and nice decor fool you. In fact real Chinese joints don't dress restaurants like this unless they were luring in ignorant Americans. The food is the same sort of "Chinese" you buy from the fast food Chinese joints in shopping center. The food was a little pricier than other places. Soup was good. I'd rather go get Vietnamese or Korean.

name: Bedel Saintange
text:
Be cautious of spring rolls as they do come with shrimp, not sure how that works.

Pretty solid rice, it's soft, light and full of flavor. Chicken is not made in wok, looks like a large batch of sweet and sour chicken that's drenched in your pick of flavor (sesame, orange, sweet & sour).

resp.text:
Thanks Bedell.
Yes, our Spring Rolls have shrimp. Chicken and pork as well. I'm not sure what you ordered today. Sone of our chicken dishes are cooked in the wok. Some are deep fried. It sounds like you ordered a dish that was deep fried. On your next visit, if you have any questions, feel free to ask for me.
Ed Duncan

name: M Greene
text: The best restaurants around.  There is a waitress name Yung who has been working there for over 25 years.  And there are several more who have been just as long.  And my family and myself have been going there for over 20 years.  Every time we go to Columbus, GA we stop there.  Because we know we are going to get the best tasting food and wonderful service.  Easily a 5 star restaurant at great prices.   Make sure you ask for Ms. YUNG!  Tell her the Greene's sent you!

resp.text: Over 20 years? We don't take that loyalty lightly, Michelle, and we really appreciate that you always make a trip out to see us. It's great you can always count on us for tasty food and friendly service, and we can't wait for you to stop by again! -Chef Lee's

name: Glenn Vargas-LaFleur
text: Best Chinese food in this area, by far. The ambience is wonderful. Chinese themed from top to bottom, from the building to the tables and chairs. Great place!

resp.text: Happy to hear how much you enjoy it, Glenn -- thanks for letting me know what you think of this place! Hope to see you again soon! - Chef Lee's

name: G Bre'Z
text: Called in an order for pick up. It was a little greasy but it was hot. It was also enough for two meals and the price was reasonable.

resp.text: We're glad you enjoyed your meal -- thanks for reviewing! Hope to see you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Randy Rogers
text: My favorite Chinese food in Columbus. The staff is sometimes rude but the food makes up for it.

resp.text: We're so happy to be your favorite, Randy! Although, we are still sorry that our team has been rude to you in the past. We take that feedback very seriously and will definitely be sure to make sure that doesn't happen again. See you next time for another round of great food! -Chef Lee's

name: Stephani Alsop
text: Great location, but that's about it. There are way better chinese restaurants in Columbus! The food is horrible

resp.text: Stephani, while now and again it's possible to have an off day, it's very rare for us to miss the mark like this. In the future, please let us know if there's anything amiss with your meal so we can fix it for you immediately. We hope we can make this experience up to you soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Scott Stearns
text: Staff is super friendly. My favorite Chinese place in town.

resp.text: Scott, we're honored to be your favorite Chinese restaurant! Thanks for all your support. -Chef Lee's

name: Patrick Benitez
text:
Hands down the best Chinese food in the immediate Columbus area. Obviously you can't compare this specific Chinese restaurant to other high caliber restaurants located in high profile cities such as San Francisco or New York, but considering the small town feel, Chef Lee's does this military town justice. I tend to go here at least once a week, thanks to their cheap lunch prices.

My top three items is as follows:

1. General Tsu's Chicken
2. Sesame Chicken
3. Shredded Beef w/ Garlic Sauce

name: Kenneth Queen (KQ)
text: Fast service. Great Chinese food!

resp.text: Kenneth, we're really glad you had a great visit! Hope you'll be back our way again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Sherry Robinson
text: Slow service but good food

resp.text: Sherry, while we do apologize that the food took a little long to come out, we're very happy everything tasted delicious. We look forward to showing you a five star experience next time. -Chef Lee's

name: Sunshineinc2011
text: Excellent food and service!

resp.text: Thanks for your excellent review! Looking forward to seeing you back our way again. -Chef Lee's

name: Susan Sendelbach
text: Beautiful Oriental art and koi pond. Super service with a wide variety of tasty food.

resp.text: Susan, thank you for the wonderful review! So glad you love the food and decor and everything as much as you do -- can't wait to welcome you back again soon for more! - Chef Lee's

name: Michael Langan
text: Lunch specials are great ...quick

resp.text: Michael, we're happy you could visit us! Hoping you come back again. -Chef Lee's

name: Jeffey Ashley
text: Great Food and Service

resp.text: Jeffey, thanks for all the support! Hoping you make it back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Michaela Conner
text: Had a very friendly server! She made the experience a lot better than expected!

resp.text: Our team truly is the best, Michaela! We love that you got a first-hand look at that for yourself. Can't wait to have you back for another round! -Chef Lee's

name: Milly Combs
text: Usually 5 star but the booths have been all smooshed together to got more I guess. Otherwise awesome.

resp.text: Milly, we appreciate the review and suggestions. Though we haven't changed or seating arrangement in the restaurant for 20 years, we look forward to making up that last star for you soon. -Chef Lee's

name: G Bre'Z
text: Called in an order for pick up. It was a little greasy but it was hot. It was also enough for two meals and the price was reasonable.

resp.text: We're glad you enjoyed your meal -- thanks for reviewing! Hope to see you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Mark Skinner
text: When i want Chinese food this is where I go. Great service and the food is always hot and fresh.

resp.text: Mark, we're really glad you could swing by! Come back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Michaela Conner
text: Had a very friendly server! She made the experience a lot better than expected!

resp.text: Our team truly is the best, Michaela! We love that you got a first-hand look at that for yourself. Can't wait to have you back for another round! -Chef Lee's

name: Ramona Bosanyi
text: Went there yesterday with my family for lunch.Beautiful restaurant.Absolutely a must if you in the area.We all ordered of the lunch menue which is $6.99.It comes with a soup egg roll and a piece of fried chicken.The food was amazing!And the service was great.Defiantly will come back.

resp.text: Ramona, we're so happy to hear how much you and your family enjoyed your lunch the other day, and we hope you'll visit us again soon for more. Thank you! - Chef Lee's

name: leonye smith
text: I went here for a work meeting and I was not impressed with the food. I got sesame chicken and it was kind of dry. My food was paid for but I wouldn't have been happy paying that much for unimpressive food. However my coworkers said they enjoyed it. I don't know if the were just being polite because the food was paid for by the company we had the meeting with.

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy the meal, Leonye -- we don't get that feedback very often, so we'll look into this. Thank you for still leaving a decent rating, though! We hope you'll come try us again sometime so we can do better for you. Best, Chef Lee's

name: Kathleen jones
text: Last time we ate there the hot and sour soup was not to good.

resp.text: Kathleen, we're sorry to hear your last visit left something to be desired. In the future, don't hesitate to let us know if anything is unsatisfactory. We'd be happy to replace it or bring you something else. Thanks for sharing this feedback with us. -Chef Lee's

name: Rashad Musulin
text: Columbus, GA proudly boasts one of the best restaurants in the United States: Epic. Run by a former gold medalist of the US Culinary Olympic Team, Jamie Keating, Epic offers a true dining experience, which is beyond excellence for any city. The ambiance is a pleasure, both to the eye , as well as the spirit.

resp.text: Rashad, we appreciate the enthusiasm but unfortunately we think you accidentally left this review on the wrong restaurant's page. That said, we still hope you'll stop by our place some time soon! - Chef Lee's

name: Kaleb Allen
text: I love this place, set in what appears to be a Chinese temple of some sort provides a wonderful ambiance. From the moment you walk in the door you receive quick seatting,service, and the best Chinese in the tri city area if not entire southeast. Lunch is affordable, dinner is more expensive.

resp.text:
Kaleb,
Thank you very much for the kind words. It's friends like you that keep us going after 30 years.
Sincerely,
Chef Lee's

name: Kenneth Queen (KQ)
text: Fast service. Great Chinese food!

resp.text: Kenneth, we're really glad you had a great visit! Hope you'll be back our way again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: leonye smith
text: I went here for a work meeting and I was not impressed with the food. I got sesame chicken and it was kind of dry. My food was paid for but I wouldn't have been happy paying that much for unimpressive food. However my coworkers said they enjoyed it. I don't know if the were just being polite because the food was paid for by the company we had the meeting with.

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy the meal, Leonye -- we don't get that feedback very often, so we'll look into this. Thank you for still leaving a decent rating, though! We hope you'll come try us again sometime so we can do better for you. Best, Chef Lee's

name: shay singleton
text: Good lunch prices Great food

resp.text: We're happy you stopped in, Shay! We look forward to seeing you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Rochelle Bautista
text: One of the best Chinese Resturants, and I should know...growing up in San Francisco and Chinatown

resp.text:
Thanks, Rochelle -- we're honored by the compliment! Looking forward to showing you another wonderful experience soon.
-Chef Lee's

name: Gregory Bean
text: Great food, atmosphere, fast, attentive wait staff.

resp.text: Gregory, we enjoyed having you -- thank you for the support! Looking forward to seeing you again. -Chef Lee's

name: Cameron Parker
text:
Ms. Lee was our server, and boy howdy she needs to just take a nap. I have been going to Chef Lee's with my family since 1997, back when they had the old location with the impressive grotto. This was such a disenchanting experience, it was my first time back in 3 years, and I regret to say it will be my last.
The tea has always been incredible. The fried rice is great, even better that it is complimentary.
That service was shameful. I have never felt more unwelcome in an asian restaurant. I have worked in five asian restaurants and I still do.
It was unacceptable the way we were treated.
Her tone was very dry, unfriendly, and condescending.
She told me I looked like a little girl and laughed to my face.
In the 20 minutes we were there, we were reminded a total of 7 times that they closed in 30 minutes, a fact I was very aware of as I called before coming over.
My girlfriend and I were basically rushed out the door ten minutes after we got our food even though three tables had still yet to order and we were very much not the last people to leave.
Also, the pineapple chicken looked like the new IT movie.
It was this scary neon clown makeup red and the sauce was so bland and sweet at the same time you could barely taste the large visible chunks of pineapple.
Kool-aid chicken would have been a much more fitting name.
We left a 20% tip she very much did not deserve.
With all due respect Ms. Lee is just awful and needs to learn how to talk to people.

resp.text: Cameron, we already responded to your previous review but want to reach out here as well. Once again, we're very apologetic for the service you received on your recent visit. We will be discussing this internally to ensure nothing similar happens again. We understand your being upset and do hope to make up this experience for you in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Rashad Musulin
text: Columbus, GA proudly boasts one of the best restaurants in the United States: Epic. Run by a former gold medalist of the US Culinary Olympic Team, Jamie Keating, Epic offers a true dining experience, which is beyond excellence for any city. The ambiance is a pleasure, both to the eye , as well as the spirit.

resp.text: Rashad, we appreciate the enthusiasm but unfortunately we think you accidentally left this review on the wrong restaurant's page. That said, we still hope you'll stop by our place some time soon! - Chef Lee's

name: Susan Sendelbach
text: Beautiful Oriental art and koi pond. Super service with a wide variety of tasty food.

resp.text: Susan, thank you for the wonderful review! So glad you love the food and decor and everything as much as you do -- can't wait to welcome you back again soon for more! - Chef Lee's

name: Mrs. D
text: Delicious food and amazing staff! Ed at the bar was beyond wonderful with outstanding customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to write your kind words -- we truly appreciate it. We hope that you'll join us for another meal sometime soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Nhan Tran
text: The service here is very good.  The food is ok, American Chinese.

resp.text: We appreciate you sharing this feedback with us. if we can make a recommendation for you next time, please let us know. We want you to love every meal you have with us. -Chef Lee's

name: Justin Mangum
text: Nasty 🤢 Food was Cold and Disgusting...  Dirty Dishes and Service was very rude. I normally don’t leave reviews but I had to on this one.

name: Sara Steinbrink
text:
I ate at Chef Lee's for the first time on May 30th 2018 with my husband and children. Seeing a lot of reviews, a high rating and then the beautiful outside and inside atmosphere I was excited to try the food. The prices were only slightly higher than what I'm used to paying in a sit-down restaurant and the service was excellent. Unfortunately, we found the food bland or overly sweet with the fried appetizers having a heavy grease taste.

More detail for my fellow read-every-review people and the owner:

We felt that the egg rolls were large and fried well but tasted bland and were greasier than we're used to; the pot stickers tasted of grease and the dipping sauce tasted only of soy, not the pot sticker sauce we know and love; the won tons in the soup were very large and there were plenty of them but there was little filling and the broth was very, very bland; sweet and sour pork had nice chunks of pork that weren't overly battered but the sauce was almost too sweet to eat (my kids have never said this before); the lemon chicken came as a whole breast that is battered, fried and then sliced which looked great and the chicken was moist but the sauce was overly sweet without lemon flavor; the orange chicken had chicken in small pieces fried so hard we had trouble chewing it and the sauce was just sweet without any orange flavor; the kung pao shrimp looked great and had a generous amount of shrimp but had a bland sauce without any heat; lastly the mongolian beef was very tender but the sauce was again way too sweet. All of the meat was of great quality and the vegetables were fresh.

I rarely leave a negative review. We don't consider ourselves to be picky eaters. We have enjoyed Chinese food all over the US and have tried 5 other Chinese restaurants in the area to date and have never been disappointed like this. I feel this must be out of the norm for Chef Lee's or they wouldn't be so successful. That said, we weren't happy with any of the food and that is out of the norm as well. Usually if one menu item is disappointing the others are fine and enjoyable. According to my experience and other one star reviews something is going occasionally but very wrong in the kitchen or the food is hit/miss and we had the bad luck of spending a lot of money there on such a night.

Sorry Chef Lee, I really, really wanted to love your place!

resp.text: Sara, it's very disappointing we didn't live up to your expectations. Now and again, it's possible to have an off night, but it's really rare for multiple plates to have issues, in this case, the sauces, mainly. We can assure you this was not a typical experience and hope you'll come back and give us another chance -- we really want to show you the reason for all the raving. -Chef Lee's

name: Mary Lee
text: Love their wonton soup and egg rolls

resp.text: Really appreciate you joining us, Mary! We hope to see you here in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Tbolt Davis
text:
Been going there more than twenty years. It is fantastic, the food is delicious and prepared so graciously.  If you haven't dined there you have missed a treat. Try it at least once you will be satisfied greatly.

Thanks,

Tbolt

.

name: Jamie Pinkerton
text: Best Chinese food in town! I love this place!! Jade Beef is soo yummy!!

resp.text: Jamie, we're honored to be called the best -- thank you so much! Looking forward to showing you another wonderful experience next time. -Chef Lee's

name: Mark Woodhams
text: Many people believe it is the best Chinese food in Columbus. They have won many awards. And if we would have gotten there has always been good.

resp.text:
Thank you Mark for the kind review. It isnt clear where we lost a star. But we sure do appreciate the 4 stars we did get. On your next visit, let us know how we can get that 5th one back.
Thanks again
-Chef Lee's

name: Rochelle Bautista

name: My Yang
text:
Disappointed.  My husband and I went here thinking there would be real Peking Duck.  We went in and realized the restaurant was ran by Koreans and not Chinese as their advertisement would say.  I asked to order a half Peking Duck and inquired if it was true Peking style that came with the buns.  The old Korean lady said "yah yah" as she answered the phone and took another order at the same time.  I asked again about the buns and she said "yes."  I paid for my order and waited.  When the food came out, I told my husband to look at the order and make sure the buns are in there.  The old lady then said "no buns unless you order full duck."  I reminded her that I asked earlier and she said yes but then the answer swiftly became a no.  Also, the way the duck was prepared was definitely not Peking duck style.. It's like breaded duck scraps. Disappointed.

Maybe sit down service might be different but definitely the Korean lady was not the greatest.  I might try eating here again but I am so dissapointed with the service that I really might not.  I would actually be more willing to drive 2 hours to north Atlanta for more authentic food.

resp.text:
Although we know it's been a few weeks since you left this review, we'd like to take a moment to clear up what appears to be a few misunderstandings, if we could. First, please know that while we employ many people from many different nationalities, Chef Lee and his wife are both Chinese, and only create authentic Chinese dishes, including the Peking Duck.  Speaking of which, it appears that you mistakenly ordered the Crispy Duck, which is very different from the Peking Duck and doesn't include the buns. If we were at all unclear in describing the difference between these two dishes, I apologize, but I hope this helps to clarify what happened. I do hate to leave a poor first impression like this, so I hope you'll consider giving us one more chance to show you a better time. I know you'll enjoy your next visit, and I look forward to proving that to you.

Should you need more personal attention, please ask for me and I will make sure you get what you need.

Simply ask for Ed ! Thanks again for the visit. I hope we can get you what you need next time.

Best Wishes, Ed - Manager at Chef Lee's Peking Restaurant

name: Stephanie G
text: I'm giving it five stars because the servers are always gracious and my drink is never empty.  My son says they're the best.  Me, I've had better but they're not horrible.  Food is ok for the price of buffet.

name: Greg Howard
text: Food was good and hot. Really good General Tso's Chicken. Service was friendly. We came at lunch time on a Saturday so everything was fresh and rotating in on the buffet line. $8.00 per adult and $2.00 for soft drinks. Great price to value ratio. Highly recommended when in town or passing through.

name: Brutally Honest
text: I don't know what location you all ate at but iIl just say that the restaurant in troy Alabama was awesome. Food hot and fresh. Sushi was great for a buffet and it was only $8?!?! What is to complain about. Lots of options nice atmosphere. Give it a try and see for yourself.

name: Savannah Buck
text: I went here with a friend and my significant other after the Troy Homecoming Game - Service was AWFUL. Our server, when spoken too about our drink glasses being empty, turned her head up and walked away MULTIPLE times, then when spoken about to the cashier, he ignores us, then when my significant other states that he can hear us, he said Yes, we we're busy. So, that's a reason to have poor customer service? I'm sorry, you had roughly 20 people in the restaurant and we were treated like that. Oh yeah, not to meantion, their health score is an 87. If you want GOOD QUALITY Chinese food, and a lot for your buck, go to China Town, a friendly, family owned, to-go or dine in restaurant.

text: The roaches tasted good to me like the ones at my home in florida and i love this resterauuunttt

name: Infidel GlockDoc S.
text: The food was okay...But the management acted like they could care less if we ate there or not.. no smiles or thank you for our business, or stopping there to eat. After being seated, nobody came to see if we needed anything..  Had to tell somebody twice. That we wanted our check..  Not remotely interested in going back there to eat again... I guess they don't need our money, by the way they acted..  And the service they gave us...  hardly worth rating.

name: Melisa
text: This place needs to close. Our waitress sat at a front table with her phone I suppose with camera on herself picking her nose and flinging what she retrieved onto the floor. Another customer walks in she seats him and does not bother to wash her hands at anytime after.

name: Chase Wingard
text:
I have been here alot. The food is only good on Sunday and every other day is a huge hit or more likely than not a miss. You get what ya pay for I guess but that a lame excuse for any establishment to have low standards of what is ok to eat that definitely wouldnt live up to healthcode standards. But I still eat there so meh. Maybe if enough people complained about the right thing, then something might improve. Who knows?

I also would like to note that most of the pics of the buffet line is far away because the food probably didnt look the best.

They take notice of empty drinks really well which is always a huge plus

Just Nasty

name: Charles Womble
text: Not fantastic but it's alright for the price. Pretty similar in food quality as the panda express but for around the same price you can eat as much as you want and have more options. Seems like most of the meat options are variations of chicken. The sushi isn't that great but it's a cheap buffet.

name: Tymira McCall Bell
text: If I could have given them a 0 I would have. The server is very rude. The nicer you are the ruder she became. Majority of the food wasn't fresh. No refills were offered or given and when trying to get server attention she will ignore you or walk pass you.

name: Kim Rix
text: Not enough selection of food and bathroom had mold when my family went there slow service and price is a little bit much would not recommend to anyone about going to eat there family got sick for to days never again

name: Aaron Darkstar
text: Nice assortment of food on the buffet that is fresh and very tasty.

name: Travis Dillard
text: This was my first experience at Lee's Chinese Buffet and will probably be my last unless serious changes are made. As we walked into the restaurant, we were seated by our hostess/waitress. She was not friendly or personable. We went to the buffet and everything seemed to be okay with the selection. It was limited compared to other Chinese restaurants. After returning to my seat, I noticed a used fork on the floor beside my chair from a previous guest. Not a game changer but I thought I would include it. My friend's chair had a thread from the carpet wrapped around the leg which caused the carpet to unravel. The water I ordered tasted off. It tasted like unfiltered tap water. I started eating my food and noticed that the food lacked seasoning. The wonton soup was also the same. I got an egg roll at the buffet and it tasted stale. It was definitely not fresh. The waitress came around only once to give us refills. We did not go back for seconds as we did not like the first plate. We waited for our check but our waitress was cutting green beans with scissors at the hostess stand. When we started walking to the counter, she gave us our fortune cookies and check as we were walking. We paid and told the checkout lady to have a great day and the formality was not returned or acknowledged. I do not recommend this restaurant.

name: Lenette Parris
text: The food was good but as I carried out it took a long time to wait on my food and there were few customers inside so I didt understand the holdup - they are mainly a buffet style dinner

name: Sterling Smetana
text: (i chose the buffet) I really liked the food, the service was amazing (the waitress was super nice and was always on top of our waters and plates etc), and the price was quite cheap (around 7$ per person for the dinner buffet). Also, the interior was pretty cultural and had a small aquarium so that was cool. Anyways, I fail to see what else someone would want in a restaurant...it exceeded all of my expectations. Easily 5 stars! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

name: Mellenie Thornton
text: Gosh! I wish I would have listened to the reviews. I went in anyway because the buffet only cost $7.50 and the food is terrible!. I never had Chinese food that tastes this bad. A lot of the items looked stale as if it had been sitting out all day. And the fried chicken tasted horrible like it wasn't even cooked all the way and it had a bad smell. There was a funny odor in the restaurant as well. It smelt like a roasting dead dog. Please don't eat here. Listen to what everyone is saying they are telling the truth! Don't make the mistake I did.

name: Michael Crump
text:
Food selection was limited.  That was okay, because what they did have wasn't very good. The place didn't look or smell clean.
I had some good friends who recommended this place and I met them there. Otherwise, I would have walked out immediately.
If you're used to good Chinese buffets, stay clear of this one.

name: Leigh Ann Allen
text: DONT DO IT GUYS! The food was so bad! The place looked and smelled horrible! After taking a bite I walked up to the lady & said I can not eat here. She simply said okay and let my family and I walk out. She must be use to people saying that. Nice people working there though. We went to the Taco Bell 2 doors down & the cashier said the same thing about the place! Taco Bell was great though

name: Mona Lisa Hogg
text: I have been eating here for 48 year's. Momma San is precious. It is an older building but the food is the best around here.

name: Justin McDaniel
text: Food selection is tiny and the establishment might not look that great, but the food is phenomenal. Tastes like real food, not the fake taste at most Chinese restaurants. That being said, it doesn't taste like your standard Chinese. I like it better than any other Chinese I've had.

name: Caitlin M. B.
text: The staff is so nice and the food is very good. I have been dining here when in town for over 15 years, and the quality of the food has always been great.

name: Dorothy Brown
text: This is one of my favorite places to eat & I am really going to miss eating here. They have the best crab Rangoon.

name: Julie Stokes
text: About 10 items to choose from on the buffet. And what they did have was absolutely terrible. I couldn't bring myself to finish any of the food I had gotten. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone

name: Eric Turrentine
text: The food was average but the service was simple and decent.

name: Brian Dunbar
text: This place has been here since I was a baby. Can't bring myself to give it less than 5 stars.

name: April Redman
text: Don't do it!! The absolute worst food I have ever had. The place was dirty. The food had been left out at least since lunch, and it was 6pm. I thought about ordering off of the menu to see if I could get food that was not spoiled, but my hopes were drown by sorrow when I saw the waitress make all the to go orders from the bar as they came in. My husband attempted to use the restroom, but quickly came back out telling us there were feces all over the wall and light switch in the bathroom.. the food smelled and tasted spoiled.

name: Tara Franklin
text: Cold, hard food, not pleasing to the eye...little variety. Cheap price (i see why). Nasty looking bathrooms, ceilings, scarey lookong and dim atmos, moldy celings but very nice lady!

name: Christopher Phillips
text: This is not your giant buffet, but it is highly affordable. And I can not even begin to describe how good the small selection they have is. It is about a medium sized buffet. Very nice atmosphere, and would highly recommend!
